Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: SaintsfanBR
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better 5star hotels I have stayed in. The staff was awesome, the bar was great, and the rooms were super clean. Everywhere I wanted to go was within 5 - 7 blocks from the hotel so it made for an easy stroll thru the city. And the Internet connection stayed connected the entire time (and that's unheard of in most hotels). After a long night I was even given a courtesy 1pm checkout. Really can't ask for more than that!!!! I travel to New Orleans at least once a month and this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: raisingkaine
Reviews.Content: 4 1/2 stars. Beautiful, sexy hotel in great location 2 blocks from the French Quarter. Walking into the freshly scented lobby immediately makes one feel that they've landed at the right address [and inspires a purchase of the burning oil at home]. The king bed room was small but well decorated and bed was comfortable. Great pillows. Huge bathroom that makes any other hotel bathroom jealous. Spend time in the sultry bar and order the Delilah. Holy Crap. Very friendly staff. Only negatives - not a lot of power coming from the shower head but not a reason to ditch this hotel. Also, to hotel mgmnt: consider making weekend breakfast times 'til 11:00 for those of us party animals that sleep a little later while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place & staff in great area”
Reviews.Author: Comprof2011
Reviews.Content: I'm ashamed I waited this long to write a review. I stayed here in double room in November 2011. In town for a conference ~ held just a block away at a big box hotel. The room was clean, and comfortable. The bath had a spacious glass shower (with excellent water pressure). Of course getting the right hotel is really individual~ I didn't really need a view, so I didn't mind the small window that pretty much looked into another building. The beds were just fine (not-please don't ever let me leave the Marriott-comfortable). But really the best part of the stay~ personalized service. Stephanie (sp?) at the front desk played "concierge" and did a better of listening, and offering suggestions for food & music, than any other hotel employee I have interacted with in almost 20 years of travel. Honestly- it made my trip. And every time I needed something, and called the front desk- they were on it within moments. The building itself has similar charm ~ great art, a cool lobby. A solid restaurant for drinks and shared plates attached... The few downsides: NO COFFEE IN THE ROOMS. I don't think anyone should have to see me before I've had coffee, but they did have it for sale in the restaurant in the AM. They did not have change at the restaurant when I tried to pay for that coffee. On the upside, when I left with the coffee (after waiting 10 minutes for the hostess to return)-- nobody accused me of inappropriate stealing... Second downside: limited power outlets in the guestroom. It's a problem if you're traveling with lots of tech. Finally: totally awesome swanky bar with good drink list in the lobby, totally slow bartenders... That I'm saying all those things and would still go back? You can't be the location, for the price, for the atmosphere and personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great bar, but the rooms just average”
Reviews.Author: sail_into_the_sun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for a reunion. The best part was the lobby and bar. The lobby is very inviting. Although our service in the bar the first time we went there was slow, that improved with later visits. As we were a large group there on a festival weekend, we had a hard time finding bars where we could all sit together and talk, so we often ended up starting and ending our nights out at the hotel bar. I do have to say they have the best Mojito I have ever tasted! Beware though, they charge extra for all the fresh herbs that are in it! The rooms were well appointed but small, dark. No safe in the room. Very low water pressure on the shower. But the beds were comfortable. The reception staff and the door man were very friendly and helpful. Overall the place was ok, but I will probably stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tikki89
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for one night on either end of a cruise to the Western Caribbean - the night of 4/7 and the night of 4/16 - and both stays were excellent. Location: The hotel itself is located just on the outside edge of the French Quarter. It was the perfect location for getting to the action, as well as for some excellent dining options outside the Quarter (we ate at Cochon and August). I would also highly recommend it for convenience to the cruise terminal should you choose NCL, which I wouldn't do again :) . Staff: The staff of the IH was amazing. So, so accommodating and friendly. When we returned from our cruise we were even able to check in at the early time of 10am. Room: We stayed in 1001 and 1101. The rooms are spacious, very well-appointed, and modern... and beds were super comfortable. The bathroom had a HUGE shower, and after a day walking around at French Quarter Fest it was much needed. We'd be thrilled to come back and stay at the IH anytime we are in New Orleans, which we hope is often!

Reviews.Title: “small room, but inviting”
Reviews.Author: yourdrugrep
Reviews.Content: our room was 'big" but it had a shower with no bath. we were given a room with a bath but it was very smaller. aveda amenities are a nice touch (like with their sister hotel loft 523). bar is very eccletic and good if you are looking for that. the only problem i had was that i had not one, but two, of rayban sunglasses missing from the valet. they were checking in on it but i have not received a response to my inquiry, when we stayed at loft 523 my gf left her dress in the room and it took a several phone calls to get it back. great location and friendly staff but it seems stuff comes up missing.....

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite & Service at IHH”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The International House Hotel and the Loa Bar is GREAT! When we arrived, we were greeted by the hip bellman at the curb, dressed in black, and escorted to the front desk. (I think they all wear black) The lobby of the IHH is stunning and the artwork is wonderful. We checked in quickly and took the mosaic tile decorated elevator up to our first room. I say our first room, because we were looking for more of a spa like experience on our weekend excursion. After being quickly and happily moved to another room in the penthouse, we proceeded to the Loa Bar. They make amazing hand made cocktails I hear, (our friend had a killer mint julep) I had Brooklyn Lager Black Chocolate Stout and we had appetizers, (3 cheese plate and grilled marinated artichokes) yum. The atmosphere was buzzing with young, hip and hot people. The next morning, we found the water pressure in our big shower was not adequate. The front desk offered to send up an engineer, but we were getting ready to leave for breakfast, so we made do and headed out again. When we returned we made the decision to upgrade to a suite, and that was a good move. The suite was sweet! The bathroom soaking tub and walk-in shower were exactly what we were looking for and quite reasonably priced. (My wife is a great negotiator) There was a large balcony with amazing city and partial river views, a large walk-in closet, one and a half baths a gigantic king size bed and a huge living area complete with baby grand piano. (I donâ€™t play, but in New Orleans, how hard could it be to find someone who plays the piano to come over and hang). We ordered room service (more great food) and invited some friends to come by and enjoy the view at sunset. Iâ€™d say the suite needs a bigger fridge and a little more storage in the bathroom and bedroom, but we really loved it. Overall, we had a delightful stay and the service was exceptional. Our check out was super smooth but our departure was too soon, weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Judy T
Reviews.Content: Even though the stay was short I was quite surprised by the service and amenities of the hotel and staff...Great Bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Simmrouter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the International House recently while we were doing some volunteer work in New Orleans. The hotel lived up to most of the previous reviews, but I would caution anyone staying in a Panoramic Corner King Room as the street noise is overwhelming! Between people shouting on the street and constant trash pickups, we got little or no sleep our first night. The front desk was very helpful in accommodating our request to change rooms for the remainder of our stay, and I highly recommend booking a room on the Penthouse Floor if at all possible. There was no street noise whatsoever, and the view was terrific. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to couples or business travelers. We had dinner one evening in Rambla which is attached to the hotel and the food was good, although the restaurant never seems to be busy like most other New Orleans establishments. The hotel bar, Ioa, is right off the lobby and is a very nice place to relax after a long day exploring New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Riveaira
Reviews.Content: Great hotel walking distance from many great attraction. The front desk staff are a great bunch. Had a wonderful time at this hotel. Only stayed 1 night so didn't get a chance to experience it too much but no complaints for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight”
Reviews.Author: azcelllo
Reviews.Content: With so many options in New Orleans, I was looking for a hip and cool place to stay. The International House met my expectations and I loved the stylings of everything from the Lobby to the sleek rooms. Equipped with amenities like aveda bath products and apple tv, I couldn't heip but feel content as it felt just like I was in a boutique in Chicago or New York but with a more reasonable price. The location was wonderful and because I was traveling alone I felt extremely safe walking to and from the French Quarter at all times (took a cab if I was staying out really late). I'm already looking forward to visiting in May and while I was thinking of trying something new, but I may just have to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. The bar in the lobby was incredible! Short walk to the FQ. Coffee shop attached to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. Big bummer. Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: Not friendly. No umbrellas (or appologies) on a week of torentially pouring rain. They were not proficient or comfortable giving directions, shopping suggestions, or even having an all inclusive map of NO. Very strange. The concierges were very sweet, one offered me her personal umbrella, but the manager was down right chilly, and again, had 1001 "good reasons" for not having any umbrellas for guests, not even for the doorman, who was only present on the day we left. So, to be clear, in the pouring March rain, we had to run 3 blocks to the Marriott to buy 5 dollar ponchos! Thank god they were selling them. And they were so friendly! By the time we got the ponchos we were totally soaked, and my brewing head cold turned into the flu as I froze my butt off until I got back into bed, where I ended up spending the rest of my trip after making our soaking wet meetings. The room was nicely decorated, but windows looked into an airshaft, the bathroom had a cracked toilet cover, horrible water pressure, broken hair dryer, teeny tiny sink, dings and dents in the doors and walls, and the lighting of the Bates Motel. Awful! This and the $16.00 they charged me for a large pot of hot water for tea closed the deal--never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: maybell_411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise was to depart. I was immediately impressed by the style of the hotel's entrance - very classy! The room was very clean and comfortable, bathroom seemed recently updated Location is great - in a safe district, but within walking distance to the French Quarter and the River Walk. There are plenty of restaurants nearby as well. Just drop your bags off in your room and take off for food and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great for work or play”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: The IHH is located right in the heart of the CBD. It's got the sort of character-plus-comfort I want when visiting NOLA, and the combination of quiet, comfortable rooms with good wifi, a cool lobby bar, helpful staff, and walking distance to more or less everything downtown, makes it a lock for my next trip. They let us check in a couple hours early, too, and were good about getting us taxis. Only gripe is that the standard king rooms are a bit small for when my colleagues and I wanted to meet up.

Reviews.Title: “IH is a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: zinn o
Reviews.Content: I love staying here. It's so convenient to the qtr and allows you to get away from it. I will be staying again, and probably again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bret F
Reviews.Content: If you like the French Quarter but don't want to stay right in it, this is a great location. But, the Staff is what will make your stay an incredible experience. From information on where to dine, relax, or tour they were all very knowledgable and always went to great lengths to make sure we had the best experience possible in Nola. This will be my 3rd stay at IH and I will definitely be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Roatan7
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, poorly finished-out, and noisy. There is almost zero deco in the rooms, which is fine, I guess, but it felt a little sad and tired. The bed was okay -- certainly not the kind of bed you get at a Westin, for example. I would have rated this hotel lower, but the lobby is very nice and the service was pretty good. If you need to stay in that area, I would try the Omni across the street, the nearby Hilton, or even the Intercontinental (which has larger rooms and more amenities).

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay on last trip to NOLA and sure wish I had!”
Reviews.Author: Tcrenshaw
Reviews.Content: On last trip to NOLA chose a hotel close to airport for convenience. Never again. I missed the IHH, a beautiful, fun and funky boutique hotel. It's in a great location close to the quarter but not too close so you can enjoy the quiet. We hosted a large scale work event at the conference center and held a block of rooms. I was pleased with the service, loved the bar attached to the hotel and had great eats at the restaurant. (Scott at Rambla knows his wine and if asked, will put together an impromptu and delicious wine tasting). As well, the bartender at Loa seems more like an apothecary to me with the fresh herbs, plantings, assortment of old fashion glasses and colorful mixers that adorn the bar. The lobby by far is the most beautiful part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: lisa e
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first visit to New Orleans, and it was perfect. The staff is incredible-- particularly Justin-- who generously gave us invaluable information on the music scene and made our trip the absolute best. It is wonderful to stay in a small, well-run hotel. It's a short walk to the French Quarter, and easy to get a cab when needed. We had a small, but comfortable room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: The experience I had at this hotel exceeded my expectations. The service from every employee encountered was at least pleasant if not more, the ambiance was great and I thought the location was superb. I would definitely return and encourage others to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design concept but very poorly maintained and they don't honor your room selection.”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunky999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his hotel as part of a group of 22 for 2 friends 20th birthday. I really enjoy boutique hotels and have stayed at many. I know going in that if it is a renovation of a much older space that I am taking a gamble. International House is a beautiful space in a great location just outside the quarter. Upon entering the hotel I was delighted by the electic glamorous feel of the small space. My delight quickly turned to frustration when I got to te reception desk. Upon check in I was told we had been upgraded to a room with a view. Normally this would have been a pleasant surprise but since I had specifically booked the Rock Star (windowless) room for our stay this was not a welcome upgrade. I politely declined the room with the view and let the clerk know that I had been looking forward to my windowless room which I had booked almost 2 months prior. At this point she informed me that in actuality the no longer had any windowless rooms available. I offered to wait until one was made available and was again told that they were all occupied. Interestingly enough our friends that arrived a few hours later were given a windowless room and when I called the front desk to inquire about how they were able to get the windowless room I was told, very courtly, they had specifically reserved that room almost a month ago and that in the future I might consider doing te same if I wanted a specific type of room. Our friends booked their room AFTER we booked! The room itself was so tiny there was not even room for a small chair. The size really wasnt an issue though as that is pretty common with boutique hotels. What wa surprising was the condition of the room. The wallpaper was peeling from the floor and ceilingin th bedroom and bathroom. The headboard was vinyl and had pen marks all over and the wall had multiple scuff marks. Oh and the upgraded window room with a view. Our view was of a wall of windows and the tops of other buildings. When the sun came up the next morning there was no option of sleeping on because even with the drapes pulled shut the room was bathed in light so I was wide awake both Saturday and Sunday morning by 6:30 am. Not exactly a relaxing weekend. Other lowlights: Very limited hours for the restaurant, bar and room service. Bar and parking super expensive. Parking with tax was 42.78 per night!! Highlights: Beautiful design Bottled Water in your room for $2.00. Party for 22 people in the altar loft was nice with tasty appetizers and good service. We visit New Orleans at least once a year and with so many hotel options I am not sure I would return. In summary they need to respect the reservation, teach their desk clerks some basic customer service skills and extend the dining and room service hours and options. Happy Travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ashley L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 02/24/2012-02-26-2012, I must say that it was great, I really enjoyed the staff as well as the room it was very nice and clean. The fact that building was only a few steps from canal st made it even better. The valet service was awesome and fast I really must say that this was a great stay and I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST VISIT”
Reviews.Author: Brenda F
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Hospitality was fantastic. I had a bad experience prior to arrival plus my car broke down 5 blocks from the hotel but once I checked in the hotel it was soon forgotten. My hat goes off to doorman Mr. Willie who took that extra step to be sure that my baggages made it to the hotel and Rebecca who put me in a room where the elevator was not needed. They have few on staff but you can not tell because what they have is team work. Everybody pitch in to make your stay is one that you will NEVER forget. Comfortable bed, great pillows and a cozy bar. On my next visit I would like to request the same room 203. THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH AND I WILL BE BACK. BF-BR, LA

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: vsirin
Reviews.Content: I wanted to escape the Milwaukee winter, so I visited New Orleans the week before Christmas with my 21-year-old daughter. I wanted to stay at Loft 523, but that wasnâ€™t possible because it offered only single beds. So I decided on its sister hotel, the International House, located around the corner, and it exceeded my expectations. Our corner room on the sixth floor was large enough to nicely accommodate two queen beds and it had high ceilings with tall windows. The room was spacious and it included a desk, easy chair with ottoman, flat screen TV, and a big dresser. The bathroom was modern and had a roomy glass shower. It was stocked with plenty of quality towels and high-end bath products. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. One staffer, Stephanie Gianopoulos, was exceptionally informative and thoughtful. She directed us to Frenchman Street and recommended what became our favorite New Orleans haunt, Three Muses, for music and dinner. For breakfast, she suggested the shrimp and grits at the Ruby Slipper on Magazine Street, and it was wonderful. By the second day, if we had a decision to make about where to go or what to see, we would consult Stephanie, and her knowledge and enthusiasm for the city directed us to all the right places . . . The sole disappointment with the hotel was the bar. It was more of a lounge with round couch like seating and the actual bar was small and cluttered and didnâ€™t encourage guest interaction. And the service was so slow. But it wasnâ€™t that big of a deal because we were in New Orleans and a quick drink is never that far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bessie2377
Reviews.Content: The staff was extrememly helpful & kind. It's a great location with lots of exciting activities & amazing restaurants all within a short walk. Their parking service takes a huge headache out of staying in such a busy area. I highly recommend staying here and I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: mjjku
Reviews.Content: The staff at the International House Hotel made it a great weekend for us 4 couples from Ohio & Sweden. Aimee with guest relations went way above and beyond to make sure we had a wonderful long weekend. The decor of the rooms and lobby was stunning. Very close the French Quarter without the noise and hoopla of being on the other side of Canal St. Dont look any further book your stay here! - Mike Westlake, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Jon's Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Nan W
Reviews.Content: Our freind Jon Lubitz' had his wedding this weekend and we all stayed at the International House. Everything about the place was wonderful. The staff was so helpful and the rooms were very confortable. It was a special weekend for all. Thanks Jon for introducing us to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: anna a
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying at International House. We loved the decor and the modern style of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and knowledgable. We will definitely stay here again. It's in a great location and you can't beat the on-site restuarant Rambla and bar Loa. They had great cocktails. Rooms were clean and bed was super comfortable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced room with excellent amenities.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: cris b
Reviews.Content: One of the most, if not the most elegant hotel in New Orleans with impeccable service, the most accommodating staff and the best location you can imagine. You are just steps from the French Quarter, a short walk to Drago's mouthwatering chargrilled oysters and next door to August, which is chef John Besh's finest restaurant. Not only that but, Rambla, the restaurant in the International House is also to die for. You are also right around the corner from the riverwalk, the aquarium, the famous riverboats, and Harrah's casino. So, if you are coming to New Orleans for fun, great dining, great location, superb service than the you can't go wrong with the International House. We stay there every visit and have never regretted it. Cris Bregman

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and NOLA Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ezedVirginia
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived the hotel (with the candle lighted lobby), until we departed three days later, the hotel and staff were great. Special appreciation goes to "Stephanie" on the front desk...who answered our dining and jazz club questions with knowledge, advice and a real "caring attitude". The overall hotel facilities are stylish, as well as comfortable and the location is excellent. Our needs, requests and expectations were all met or exceeded. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a vacationer, not so great if you travel a lot for work.”
Reviews.Author: brickofcontrol
Reviews.Content: I usually want 3 things in a hotel room. Comfy mattress, clean room, good shower. The shower in this room was horrible. It was either a fine useless cone of water that went completely around you, or a massage setting that felt like it was ripping your hair out. Gets a little old after a few days. Also, if you like to see what you are doing or wearing after dark, bring a flashlight. The two dim bedside lamps aren't enough. I had to iron (with the worst smelling iron on a really wobbly board) in the bathroom so I could see what I was doing. This place was decorated nice, it was clean, and the location was pretty good. The doormen were also very friendly and useful (not necessarily the people behind the counter). Might stay here again if I was there for fun, but definitely not for work.

Reviews.Title: “What more would you want?”
Reviews.Author: number22foryou
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, great location, friendly front desk staff and it has a great vibe!!

Reviews.Title: “Check your bank account !!!”
Reviews.Author: Yauhen B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stay at International House. The hotel itself is ok. We have to wait quite a long time to be checked in because front desk lady were trying to answer constantly ringing phone, talk to one of her colleague and look for something behind the desk at the same time. This was the only complain we had during we stay. A week after we stay I checked my credit card account and found almost 500$ overcharge from the International House and here my troubles started. It took for me 6 day before I spoke to someone from accounting who said that they processed the refund. I have to call them a dozen of times and they will just transfer me to GM or accounting where nobody picks up the phone. Twice they took my information telling me that I will receive call back - never happened. What really upset me that only one time, no the fifth day, Jane (I think that was her name) said I am sorry. Will never stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “International House- Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J
Reviews.Content: Staying at this boutique hotel & had a great stay with my friends. Planning to go back top stay here for Mardi Gras. Great bar and front desk service when I checked in. Didn't have to lift a bag!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie W
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in New Orleans and a very comfortable stay at the hotel. Very nice room. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “value and service”
Reviews.Author: tunessmith
Reviews.Content: I can say this of International House - it's one of a kind! The staff is helpful and eager to make an "experience" of your stay in New Orleans. I don't think I've ever seen a bed made up so neatly as the housekeeping does here. Location is perfect for all the hot spots in New Orleans. Walking to the French Quarter is safe and easy as is the walk to Frenchmen St. for music. I hear they have another hotel just down the block called Loft523 - may check that out next time since the same staff works both locations.

Reviews.Title: “You're going to want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Marc D
Reviews.Content: Everyone has a great lobby, comfortable beds, nice linens, etc. So when choosing a hotel it comes down to the staff - specifically their attitudes. The IH has the most upbeat, helpful, genuine staff that I have experienced in a long time. 100% "how can I help you" attitudes. From the front desk to the doorman and the bartender - not a snob in the place. From directions to suggestions and even fetching a cell phone from the car AFTER is was in valet parking, they set the customer service bar high. Then for a bonus, it's an easy walk to the French Quarter, Jackson Square or the Convention Center. A great location, great accommodations and best of all great staff.

Reviews.Title: “International House is a gem”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQinHou
Reviews.Content: Great location! Great staff! Great lobby! This is a beautiful boutique hotel in true trendy New York / LA style. As soon as you walk up to the front door, you will realize this hotel is special. I have read some negatives about the rooms, but couldn't disagree more. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. We had two rooms - a double queen (no view but we were warned about that - still bright and pleasant) and a corner king which was amazing. Both were very large and comfortable, and decorated like the hip boutique it is. Comfortable beds, great toiletries and robes. They did have blow dryers, but no under sink storage shelves and no in-room safe. Service was impeccable! My husband would not like it - if you want the Ritz Carlton or Windsor Court, it's not for you. Room service and bar hours are limited (5 pm - 11pm) but the staff was wonderful in recommending my teenagers order pizza to be delivered from John Besh's Dominica around the corner and the girls loved it. When it was delivered, the front desk even called to ask if the girls wanted to come meet the delivery man in the lobby or would it be okay to send him up. I would recommend this whole heartedly!

Reviews.Title: “I got a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: Travelsouth1
Reviews.Content: The room rate made up for the room. The lobby is attractive and cool. Reception was very nice. The room was clean. The Bathroom was pathetic. I cannot imagine people paying upwards of 500.00 for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: dhooptalab
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, beautiful room. Just a pleasure to stay at. Not for people who like generic luxury, definitely for people who appreciate thoughtful attention to style and individuality!

Reviews.Title: “Neat Vibe, Awesome Bar”
Reviews.Author: yagators
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place with some girlfriends during a three day weekend. It is a very nice hotel but the selling feature is most definitely the lobby and especially the bar. If you come in at night like we did you are welcomed to candle light and a very pleasant aroma. The bar has more interesting smells as fresh herbs are everywhere. The drink menu at the bar is absolutely fantastic and has some very unique choices. I was particularly pleased at the fresh fruits that they used in their drinks. Our room was surprisingly spacious. The four of us fit into it fine but did notice that the beds were a tad small as they were full beds instead of queens. It really didn't effect us too much because we are all small but a bigger group might have a problem with it. The shower was huge and by far the best feature in the room. The counter space in the bathroom was also small but we all managed fine. The only real complaint we had was a lack of outlets for hair equipment. The staff was friendly and accommodating. When we needed extra robes and towels they brought us some within 15 minutes. They provided great options for local restaurants and remembered us when we dropped off our bags and returned later. The location could not be beat. It was two blocks away from Bourbon Street and walking distance to the French Quarter and the trolley. What's great about this hotel is that you are close enough to the hustle and bustle to get out and party but far enough away to sleep. All around a great stay and even if you choose another hotel the bar is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very chic”
Reviews.Author: gardenercc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at International House Hotel over New Years and the Sugar Bowl, so the prices were inflated. The front staff was very nice and helpful as was the door man. WE parked our car her and the valet was nice and quick whenever we needed the car. The lobby is very cool, small bar, computer for guests to use. We had 3 rooms amongst our group, one double double 2 single queens. the double double room 305 was huge, with a walk in closet, with no light, very hard to see anything in, and a bathroom almost the size of one of the queen rooms which were quite tight for $219 a night. Little glitches, no toiletry refills for 2 days, then that was straightened out, no extra toilet paper, had to call down at 11 at night for more. room was dark couldn't see in closet, and it didn't seem to matter what we put the temp on it didn't seem to change. It would be nice to have a complimentary coffee service set up in the morning, the bar area would be simple to do it in. the location is perfect, 2 blocks off the french quarter, a block from the trolley. We had no worries as far as safety at this location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cooliest bar ever”
Reviews.Author: Kathleenmb86
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. staff was beyond nice and helpfull!! Rooms were very tasteful. Location wonderfull, could walk pretty much everywhere. The bar was our favorite thing, it was beyond cool, The bartenders/mixologists were so much fun they all really seemed to enjoy making our cocktails. Vintage bar ware, cool atmosphere, interesting drinks made with freash herbs (Check it out). The only reasons the hotel doesn's get 5 stars are no coffee in the room/ strong perfume smell in the lobby/ undesirable room service menu. but the good out weighd the bad for sure and would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What was that noise??!!”
Reviews.Author: Zack3239
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and clean rooms. Grossly overpriced for BCS Bowl Weekend. Premium price for a very average, but clean room. Rooms do NOT have safes so you have to use safe deposit boxes at front desk A bit cumbersome to say the least. Horrofic noise came from cooling unit outside our window every time is turned on. Sounded like a car crash every time...over and over again....Complained to staff and were told "nothing they could do". No other rooms available. Convenient location to French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “International House is a modern and sophisticated hotel in the heart of New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Oliveanita
Reviews.Content: International House is a beautiful, contemporary boutique hotel...the perfect serene counterpoint to New Orleans Bourbon St. You can stay out late and then come back to your sophisticated urban nest. There were also some surprises--the walk-in shower and the swanky bar Loa (great cocktails and a cool crowd) really added to my enjoyment. Location was perfect, just a two blocks from the streetcar and very close to the French Quarter or a short walk to the arts/warehouse district. Â

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but nothing special either”
Reviews.Author: jl2117
Reviews.Content: It's not bad by any means, just don't expect anything special. Very good location, as we easily walked to both the Quarter and the Convention Center at different times. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Outside of the front desk, the staff was invisible. Knew going in that it only had valet parking but there was no one outside to take the car or help us with bags. Front desk suggested that the valet must be busy. We could just leave the car keys at the desk. No offer to help with bags or anything else. The first room we were given smelled like smoke so I went back down to ask for a different room. It's supposed to be a completely smoke-free hotel but the desk person didn't seem bothered much by this news. She just swapped out keys and once again did not ask if we needed any help with our bags. The room was small and nothing special. Again, it was fine, but the service level doesn't live up to a "boutique" label and the near $200/night price tag (w/parking) we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: claire g
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in November. Our entire visit was a very positive experience. Not only is IH a stylish, comfortable hotel with a great location close to the French Quarter, but the staff was unusually warm, welcoming and helpful when it came to planning our activities. I had never visited New Orleans before and was anxious to explore the city. Every morning we would visit the desk and walk away with suggestions for places to visit, modes of transportation, walking routes, restaurants, etc. When we checked out, I really felt like I had really gotten to know New Orleans. Claire and John Griffin Brooklyn, NY

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JayRL_11
Reviews.Content: The International house Hotel is a recently renovated property that is just two blocks off Canal on Camp Street. The location is great; a short walk to most French quarter and CBD venues. The public spaces of the hotel are very attractive and interesting. The design and feel of furnishings is very modern with many interesting architectural touches. The hotel room and bath was clean and comfortable but nothing to shout about. We liked the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney B
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Perfectly located. Close to streetcar line and French Quarter within walking distance. Beautiful rooms (Aveda bath products) and very helpful staff (Jonathan my personal favorite). Lovely bar and great restaurant as well as an outstanding array of restaurants nearby. -CourtneyB

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great.”
Reviews.Author: bevsdogs
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive hotel. It probably would have been better if we had not been there on The BCS championship weekend. It was extremely crowded and the rates were inflated for the 3 day weekend. It was however missing some of the amenities one would expect when you are paying $500/night. Although the staff was friendly their duties were a bit stretched. Since the hotel entrance is on a busy street it was difficult to load and unload luggage.The room service menu is quite limited. Overall I would have to revisit it on a normal weekend to give a unbiased review.

Reviews.Title: “Good, missing some basics.”
Reviews.Author: 1r2ns
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get a hotel room the week of the BCS Championship. The International House is not in the French Quarter, but a very walkable few blocks away. It was also convenient to the casino, superdome, and convention center. We paid about 3-4x the going rate because New Orleans hotels were all charging a premium that weekend. The room was very basic -- 2 queen beds a dresser and small closet. The bath was sufficient, but also rather small. There was no room safe, mini-bar, ice machine or vending machines. I consider those pretty standard these days. The front desk staff were nice, but seemed flustered at times especially with the hotel safe. The bar was okay. The attached restaurant was tapas and before we were served 2 other tables walked out because they had not been waited on. The food was pretty good and we felt lucky to get any. Our major complaint was this incredibly loud noise every hour or so 24 hours a day. At first we thought it was a car screeching its brakes on the street outside the hotel. After about 15 times we realized it must have been an a/c or heating unit. I cannot adequately describe how ridiculously loud it was. We would have done something in a normal situation, but the entire town was full so we just dealt with it. As a value hotel, I would say this is an okay and convenient place to stay. I do not consider this a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Brett1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August for a weekend trip with friends. We loved the hotel! The place is cool, the service good, and the location was great. The lobby bar was fun and usually had a good crowd. It was a short walk to the French quarter, so it was a perfect place to stay and explore. We also chose to do a haunted history ghost tour. I don't remember the name of the tour, but it starts just outside Marie Laveau's House of Voodoo (cool place to check out). Any tour operator can tell you which one it was. It ended up being the highlight of our trip. I also highly recommend the Coffee Pot for breakfast. We went there twice it was so good! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge, fabulous bar”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff, discrete and helpful. Lobby is very classy. Concierge Stephanie directed us to great restaurants and sites. ( Don't miss Ogden museum). Rooms spacious and understated. Best of all a tv-less bar and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Captain68
Reviews.Content: I was initially "forced" to stay in a major hotel chain for a conference - but as soon as I found out that International House was just around the corner, I moved! Very cool lobby, nicely decorated rooms, but the outstanding feature of this hotel is the level of personal service! From the front door, to the frond desk, to anywhere else in the hotel - it seems they cannot do enough to make sure your stay is everything you want it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Green202
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and loved it. The hotel is in a great location and the staff had lots of tips and good advice. We will absolutley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: jerry m
Reviews.Content: I ha ve stayed at the International House many times and always come back! From the lobby with the fragrant candles to the wonderful relaxing rooms, it is very special. Freindly staff adds to the enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Darby J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at International House in New Orleans many times - and it consistently one of the best (not only in New Orleans - but the country)!! The opulant lobby and Loa Bar set the stage for the well-appointed guest rooms...simply beautiful with high-end bath products and sumptuous linens. The customer service is also second-to-none, you are made to feel special and important upon entrance of the grand doors on Camp Street. I can't say enough good things - other than run, don't walk. International House is a glowing and welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon Street. If you are looking for a weekend away in the French Quarter - look no further - this one is a must-stay!!! - Darby Jones, Atlanta Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: L A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a great area; it was 15 walking minutes away from everything I wanted. The Superdome, Bourbon Street and nice restaurants were all within walking distance. I thought the staff was very courteous and attentive to our needs; they even had three Band-Aids for my friend, at 3 a.m., who skinned her knee after the Hand Grenades and the Jester kicked in. LOL Room 906 12/16-18/2011

Reviews.Title: “Got engaged there this past week end!”
Reviews.Author: grrtcple
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of there way to make us feel at home. Had single rose on bed pillow upon check-in! Made our reservations for week end. Couldnt have been nicer!

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steven R
Reviews.Content: We have gone with friends to JazzFest every year since 2005. We have stayed at the International House each time. We have never been disappointed. It is a terrific place to stay. It is clean and modern. It is two blocks out of the French Quarter in the Central Business District. It is within easy walking distance of all the great restaurants. It has a great bar. We are looking forward to staying there, again, for JazzFest 2012. If you are traveling to New Orleans, I would strongly recommend the International House. Steven Rubenstein

Reviews.Title: “It needs much improvement to be called a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KarolinChicago
Reviews.Content: Very standard. I really expected much more after seeing the picture that advertises this hotel. More service, more details, more space, more charming atmosphere. The result is a dull hotel which boast to be a boutique hotel, but has a lot to learn from other really good standard boutique hotels. What is this lack of light at nigh, it make a very depressing welcoming when you enter the reception at night. Either it will be nice to have some more details such as complimentary coffe or tea in the room, some fruit in the reception for welcoming the guests (apples for example). It is the small details that makes quality in a hotel, not the fotoshop of the entry of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything great!”
Reviews.Author: bamafan43
Reviews.Content: 1st time at hotel..was a great surprise! Staff exceptional, Well done on decor, rooms very comfortable,,little small, but fine and well appointed. huge bathrooms, and closets. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne C
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the Intl House. I messed up our reservation and the staff (Amy, James and Jeremy and Joe) did a great job getting us settled earlier than checkin time and treated us great regarding the price. I will definitely stay here the next time I travel here. Place is quaint and beautiful and in a great location too. Check them out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: robotmuppet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. Really wonderful value for what it offers. Although the rooms are small and the service is a bit no-frills, this hotel wins because of its location. It is a block outside of the French Quarter, so you avoid the noise and bustle but have easy access for touring around. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Hansen G
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the International House. It's a great hotel. The tasteful decor sets a peaceful mood, and the hotel room's are so comfortable. I chose this hotel, in part, because I knew I could enjoy the festivities of the French Quarter but also return to a quiet room where I could also indulge in a good night's sleep. The hotel has added touches -- like beautiful black & white photos of New Orleans in its rooms -- that remind you that you're in New Orleans without being overly commercial. I also found that the staff was excellent, very helpful and willing to help make this stay a good one. Compared to the prices of some of the other hotels in the area, the International House surprised me as a really good deal. A couple things to deal with, though: there wasn't in-room coffee serice, but the coffee in the breakfast area of the restaurant was good. And, you don't need to use their valet service to park your car. There's a parking garage located one block right before the hotel's entrance on Camp Street that is easy to use. Basically, you just park your car, cross the street, and you're in the hotel's lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Unique and Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: Travel L
Reviews.Content: International House... a one stop shop for an all-emcompassing travel experience! Personable and knowledgable staff throughout; a luxurious melt-into-the-ambiance lobby; and gorgeous, comfortable make-yourself-at-house guest rooms. Not to mention the Hotel's bar, Loa and Restaurant Rambla have divine service, decadent cuisine and drinks to die for! Definitely making this Hotel my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul V
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and it's always a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel would add a couple small changes”
Reviews.Author: terrapinobx
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the Internaional House thursday afternoon nov 3rd. the lobby is well appointed the staff quick and friendly. we had reserved a corner room on the 9th floor (908). floor to ceiling windows with a great view of Camp St. Bathroom very attractive with plenty of room. The king bed was just the right firmness. The corner room has plenty of space. An iron board is helpful but room needed a safe. I love a ceiling fan and the room had one. The hotel has wonderful small chairs and tables out front to sit and enjoy the sun light (which we did with a cocktail). Speaking of cocktails the Loa bar is great. Very attractive bar with wonderful herb infused cocktails made to order.(no jug of premade hurricane mix here). Internet in the lobby as needed. wifi in the rooms but slow. We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked good. The location to bourbon st canal street the bus lines and street cars can't be beat. The Jazzy Pass 3 dollars a day is a steal. The staff was quick to have wake up calls cabs called extra shampoo taken care of quick and with a smile. A couple things I would add or change. Safe in the room. Coffee available before 7am(with out room service) pot in room or in lobby. wifi in the room cut out a few times(would check that). Small things and not a game changer by any means. we would come back in a second and have told many friends about it. I will do atrip report in the forum soon on other aspects of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Situation”
Reviews.Author: mklor
Reviews.Content: we were originally reserved for the loft 523 and were not comfortable in the room. I spoke with the manager, Justin about how we were not happy and kindly asked if our room could be changed or if we could go to their sister hotel which was international house. He was very accommodating and walked us over to the hotel and introduced us to Jonathan and said he would be taking care of us. Jonathan showed us the penthouse room for the same rate and the outside space is great. Eventhough, when you're in New Orleans you don't spend much time in your room, being able to sit out there and take in the city is a treat. The International House was a great find and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MnGoph
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in "boutique" hotels before(Avia in Savannah, GA) and were somewhat disapointed in the IH. We had a Terrace King which advertised access to the roof top garden. I envisioned a large open terrace type area. What we got was a small area that was about 4ft by 8ft with a small table and two chairs. Room was nothing special. I booked the room 6 months ahead and signed up for a breakfast each day for $10. I had forgotten about this and when we checked in, there was no mention of the breakfast option,nor were we even told of the hours when breakfast was available. The first morning, we went to the desk and asked for a recommendation for breakfast. The host told us of a place called Ruby Slipper about two blocks away. Again not even a mention of breakfast in the hotel. BTW, Ruby Slipper is excellent!!! Issue number two--when booking online, I didn't see any type of military discount offered so I assumed that they didn't offer one. I happened to ask the desk one day and they said that they didn't. However, when checking out, I asked again and the clerk said that they generally give a 10% discount. They were nice enough to credit my AmEx for that. They also credited the breakfast costs that we never used. Issue number three - a biggie....I happened to leave a power cord for my laptop in the room. I called the next day and they had found it and said they'd send it to me via FedEx and just bill my credit card. I realize that they can't possibly afford to pay shipping for every item that might be left behind so I told them it would be fine and that there was no hurry. The person I talked to said that they'd ship it FedEx ground which I figured to be 3-5 days at approx $20...To my surprise, it was shipped FedEx Priority overnight express....and my card was billed $61.00 Considering all the options, we will look elsewhere for our next visit to Naw-lens

Reviews.Title: “Not great room”
Reviews.Author: jennyak
Reviews.Content: The international house has a great lobby and bar. The unique feel with the candles lit at night is very unique and the thumping lobby music is unusual but cool. That said, I wouldn't stay again. The room was so-so at best. The linens and towels were good and fluffy but the bedroom was small. There'd was a big dip in the floor next to the bed covered by the carpet but easily tripped on. The wallpaper was bubbling off the walls. Worst was the bathroom. There'd was little space on the vanity to place toiletries. And over 5 nights in the hotel I never got a truly hot shower. The water temperature was lukewarm to warm at best and my husband I took several that were downright cold. We asked the front desk doe help and they said they would send an engineer. We didn't notice a considerable improvement. The water pressure was also very low - a problem our friends in another room also shared. So, if you rare looking for ambience in the lobby with a fairly quick walk to the Quarter, this might work. If the comfort of the actual room is more important, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “decent location but too small”
Reviews.Author: C D
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful, the lobby has a funky small bar, but the room was small, the shower didn't function and one of two elevators was out of service. Next time we will stay in the quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique in walking distance of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Kimnola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the International House Hotel for our wedding festivities for 4 days in October as well as all of our out of town guests. It could not have been more perfect! Everybody loved their stay... The atmosphere was perfect... small, boutique, chic! We met up in the bar and lobby for everything and walked everywhere. The location is perfect. Thanks, Vivien for giving us a perfect wedding festivity weekend. We will be back and so will our guests! You guys made it so very special!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ranger w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting. Desk staff very nice and helpful. Food not that great but you are just around corner from 1000 places. We did not have hot water one morning. Showers do not put out a lot of water or warm water. Roome very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling to visit daughter at Tulane”
Reviews.Author: RhondaLeighCaryFried
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient and safe. The rooms have very clean lines and are very comfortable. The hotel has a separate bar and restaurant. Very Chic !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere, quiet, yet near everything”
Reviews.Author: GeoH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July after returning from a Caribbean cruise. We loved it! Very friendly staff, happy to help with luggage, booking tours and getting a cab. Also, this place is just a short walk from the end of Bourbon St. It's close to everything. We will definitely stay here again. Thanks, International House!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea M
Reviews.Content: By andrea, 9/30/11 This was my first visit @ the IH hotel, and l loved it all around, the Staff was WONDERFUL, the hotel was beautiful and I just loved when they turned the lights down and lite candles in the lobby after hours, the location was awsome everything was in walking distance. I give the IH hotel a 10 thumbs ups! JUST WOUNDERFUL!!!! and I will be back for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, unusual and great cocktails in a perfect setting, beautiful, peaceful room. I would love to return and experience more of the wonderful charm of International House.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brian l
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the international house, we were pleased in all aspects of this boutique hotel. Nothing was cookie-cutter about this place. walking into the lobby was almost magical, well lit with chandeliers and candles and oversized furniture. its modern,chic,warm and inviting. great indication of what is to come.the staff were excellent~Justin checked us in and answered all the questions we had about our stay. Heres more magic for you. We stayed in Penthouse 4~we had an idea of what to expect but really no clue.My girl started crying and jumping up and down. It was perfectly decorated and had an amazing view from our private balcony. A baby grand piano was in the corner and a marble table welcomed us. Huge everything!!!we wer blown away. It made our vacation worry free with all the help and knowlege the staff was willing to give us We are STILL recanting our experience there. We recommend this to all!! A def. "Do before you die"

Reviews.Title: “Louisiana Charm”
Reviews.Author: TxRedbird
Reviews.Content: My husband reserved a suite for a surprise weekend getaway and I could not have been more impressed. Having lived a short drive from New Orleans most of my life, I have stayed in plenty of hotels and this was by far my favorite. It has a charm you only find in boutique hotels, the attention to detail and unique aura of feeling that it is a well-kept secret. The lobby and bar decor was very chic and candle lit. I was impressed that the bar has taken on the newest trend of mixing drinks like you are in an old apothecary. And the hotel is situated in a great location only a short walk from the Quarter. We stayed in a large corner suite with a chandelier, overstuffed chairs, and huge windows overlooking 2 directions. The Aveda bath products were a nice touch as well. While we were out my husband arranged several personal requests with the staff that were all attended to before our return to our suite. We will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Southern warmth. Where else can you get that?”
Reviews.Author: Hungryspirit
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at International House. Hip, edgy, but warm and friendly--how do they do that? We're not especially hip, but we feel as though we fit right in, dressing nicely (casual but nice, not schlumpy and sloppy which we hate to see in big city hotels. You want to feel as though you're presentable and civilized at International House). Extraordinarily helpful staff (they bought and brought us a Sunday New York Times to our door!). Location couldn't be better---out of the silliness of the Quarter (but just 2 blocks from Canal), and right in the heart of the increasing lively buzz of the CBD---within walking distance of myriad great restaurants and street scenes. Walk to the Ogden Museum of Southern Art (a must-see), to the farmer's market, to the bus and streetcar lines (which are very easy to use in NOLA--be sure to buy a day or 3- or 6-day pass!). Our rooms have always had exquisitely-appointed bathrooms--roomy and lush. We're now spoiled and doubt that we'll stay anywhere else when in the Big Easy. Coming back from the heat of the city, International House feels like a cool, welcoming and comfortable oasis. The bar rocks, in our book: Friendly and attentive bartenders making all manner of traditional to edgy cocktails. Hip, buzz feel emanates from the lobby into the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place in NO”
Reviews.Author: deacon123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a business associate. It is a cool boutique hotel with the decor to match its claim. The rooms are all a tad small (as boutique hotels mostly are, in my experience). The in house restaurant has an excellent b'fast. The only drawback for it is their cancellation policy. Be sure that you are going to stay before securing the room.

Reviews.Title: “MIXED FEELINGS mostly BAD”
Reviews.Author: james s
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans on business to pick up a company car to take back Nashville a few months back. My Girlfriend and I thought it would be neat to spend the weekend in the city since we have never been. We decided to stay at the International House because of the great location from the French Quarter and we got a great deal online for 2 nights and knew we would spend minimal time at the hotel. We stayed in one of their "Rock Star Roomsâ€� which was not a bad room as far as size and comfort. Some people on other reviews complained about no windows which this did not bother us at all. The hotel claimed they were Rock Star rooms due to stars loving them because you can sleep with no noise from outside, which is NOT true we could hear everything in the halls it was very loud! Room had a nice T.V and bed was comfortable, but towels had stains on them which we were not fans of. Staff was okay, but not good kind of in their own world. When I stay at a hotel I like to see smiles from staff which I didnâ€™t see. Bar was average at best, drink were not great under poured for price and if it was my hotel I would switch the lighting in bar which was hands down too bright and they had a cool feel in the lobby but was dark. I feel like it should be opposite lobby shall have the light and bar area should be dim like 98% of most hotels. THE WORST PART of our stay was we had Valet parked my new company car for $38 per night on Friday and when it was returned on Sunday at our check out it had been BASHED. While it was in their hands my rear end was demolished of course I was not very happy about this. The valet manager Jared Farrell told me not to worry about anything and he would take care of it all and have my car fixed right away and then apologized. I then went up to the hotel front desk and said â€œI would not be paying for valet since my car was returned in such wayâ€�, she somewhat rolled her eyes and gave me my money back. No apology not a " hey please come back we are so sorry about what happened to your property we would love to comp a room for one night in the futureâ€�, Nothing! Jared Farrell seemed like he was new at the valet gig which was uncomforting since he was the manager what manager doesnâ€™t have a business card? Of course Jared did nothing after the fact my company tried to contact him multiple times no calls back, nothing back from their insurance. My company then had to get our own insurance company involved to take care of the damage. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!! All and all that ruined my trip and I had to drive a wrecked car back home. I give this hotel a 4 at best! We will definitely stay elsewhere next visit to New Orleans. Also just a heads up Riverâ€™s Edge Restaurant in New Orleans is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. Worst excuse for food and service, I feel like I got robbed after paying form food which we didnâ€™t eat! Donâ€™t Do It!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Staff, We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Doctorev
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 2 short blocks from French quarter, can get everywhere from here either walking or by cab. Staff papmers you in the rain - takes care of everything. Hotel lobby is impressive - great intimate lounge, gorgeous art. Room was beautiful, well appointed, lovely linens - amazing bathroom size. We loved the energy of this place

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: in2xtc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on a Saturday afternoon. We couldn't check in right away but the gentleman at reception was very friendly and helpful in trying to find an available upgraded roomtype. He was able to get us into a beautiful corner room with a big soaking tub. The furnishings were eclectic and well designed and the room had tall ceilings and floor to ceiling window on two walls. Like most boutique hotels in older buildings, there is not much soundproofing so lots of street noise during the day and early morning. This hotel has an ideal location for walking; only a few blocks in any direction to French Quarter, casino or restaurants in the Warehouse District. The only complaint I had was the the attached bar didn't open until 4pm and the Rambla Restaurant has odd hours as well. Breakfast hours ended very early. Not very convenient for hotel patrons. Overall a good stay and would return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Have already booked my next trip back to International House”
Reviews.Author: 160jojack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We stayed there to drop our our daughter at Tulane, and thought the location was perfect. Sightly off the beaten path, but easy to get on St. Charles to drive to Tulane, but within walking distance of the French Quarter, easy for restaurants, etc. The room was comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. The lobby was also charming, and nicely lit in the evenings. The front desk could not have been more accommodating with directions, or other information. Housekeeping at the hotel was also great, and if we wanted a change of towels later in the day, they came right up to the room. Parking, while expensive, was also convenient, and whenever we called downstairs they had the car waiting for us within minutes. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Dez J
Reviews.Content: The staff, location and the price you just cant beat... The bed was sooo comfy haha.. It is one of New Orleans hidden jewels.. I wouldnt pick any other hotel while in the Big Eeasy..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patty D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the International House last year when we took our son to school at Loyola. That visit was one of the most pleasant hotel experiences we've ever had. The room was beautiful, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel location was perfect for easy access to many different destinations and activities. We also enjoyed the atmosphere and the delicious cuisine in Rambla (restaurant). We will definitely choose the International again and have recommended the hotel to several friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: D_Smith11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very beautiful Lobby an bar area even the restaurant was beautiful an that candle they burn made those areas smell so good, we booked the Rockstar room on d 11th floor, I think it's like six of them.It didn't have a window which was great no sun to awake us from our much needed sleep after all night party n!! Ok the bathroom was big a spacious an very clean!! The bed was ok nothing to go crazy about,it also has a flat screen tv which was nice an also u can charge ya iPhone if you forget ya charger on d radio,there was a nice desk with two bottles of water which I couldn't believe u had to pay for $2 for them an it also had a nice little how can I put this above d bed there was a hole in d ceiling which lead to a ladder which I don't know were it would take u lol kinda strange but it was dusty so I figured no one was climbing out of it on d regular lol!! An last but not least it had a big brick wall in d room which was different for me but kinda nice, my overall stay was good an I would stay here again o I forgot to mention I got d room for only $59 a night so that was a Bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: sheranj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Wonderful and helpful staff. Our room was great. Very large and quiet. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy overall... small room, but good price and great bar”
Reviews.Author: Silverpink25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. I thought it was a great value. Our room was extremely small, but cozy, and it was perfectly fine for 2 of us since we weren't planning on spending much time in the room. We wanted a location that was easy walking distance to everything, yet not right in the middle of craziness, and with a nice bar. This place fit the bill. The drinks at the bar were expensive, but awesome. The cocktails changed each night and the bartenders were pros. It was quite the happening spot at night. The lobby was also super nice. My husband wasn't thrilled with the size of the room, or the complete lack of any sort of view from our window, but otherwise everything was great. I will stay here again on my next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with no windows”
Reviews.Author: rsa0
Reviews.Content: No, this is no Hitchcok hotel, but is not too far. Location is pretty nice, fairly close to downtown and famous Burbon street. That was the good. Now the bad. By no means this is a cheap hotel. Ones would expect a bit better service when booking here. Upon arrival we were met with some construcion work going on there, and the elevator blocked for this purpose. Finally we catch the workers on a moment when they were not closer and up we go, to our room. Here was the 2nd surprise. There were no windows on any of the walls. Stay away from the room at 11th floor called "Rock &Roll". Unless you feel like going into a crypt, then this room is not for claustrofobics. Eventually the room was changed. Next morning we're going for breakfast at the downstairs restaurant "Rumbala". One piece of advice: don't put it on your room. You'll be charged tip in advance and get the food when the waiter (part time bar tender) will consider it is the right time... for him. Do yourself a favor: go across the road where there is a nice little place, clean and friendly. At departure the receptionist offered us a discount on the next booking if we leave them a favorable review on TripAdvisor... That ain't going to happen until they improve. Overall, the hotel is average, definitely not worth what they charge, and only saved by its location. We won't be visiting them any way...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip.. We will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: ltcarhart
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I plan a weekend getaway to new orleans every couple of months just to get out of town. This time, we decided to try out the international house. The location was phenomenal, the staff was excellent, and we LOVED the room! International house is literally two blocks away from bourbon, which was perfect. We loved the proximity, and the fact that when we were done, we could go to the hotel for the night and be out of the hustle of the quarter. The bar downstairs (Loa) was perfect as well! The bartenders really knew their stuff, and both nights we went, I just told them to make me something good, and i have no complaints. The front desk was super accommodating, and helped us to locate a good dinner restaurant on Friday (Lukes was a block and a half away, and WONDERFUL). The actual rooms were a perfect size, and the decor was great. We were VERY satisfied, and both said multiple times how we will definitely be back. We cannot wait for the return trip! Thank you so much, international house, for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Erica S
Reviews.Content: We went to NOLA for a friends bachelorette party. The International House was very clean and the concierge was extremely helpful. We went for a long weekend and each night they recommended different places for us to dine and go out. I would definitely stay at the International House again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected class and special treat”
Reviews.Author: Johnandalyx
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling around the world, including a cross country road trip from NYC to CA and found ourselves booking a night through a voucher offered by Travelzoo for $99.99 for The Apple Room. Yowza! The Apple Room is in the Penthouse floor with beautiful furniture, spacious ceilings, and luxurious bathroom, but no tub...and no coffee, but that's okay...I was willing to overlook because we were within walking distance of Cafe Du Mond, where we had to visit for beignets and coffee. It's so incredibly hot throughout the South right Joe o finding a little oasis in the International House Hotel wad a real treat, and especially because we got such a great deal...so chic and so N'awlins class...

Reviews.Title: “A total Jem!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiffnmatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love New Orleans more and more each time we visit. This last time, I wound up booking at the International house. What a find! It is a quaint yet fashionable boutique hotel! It's location is perfect. A few steps away from the French quarter, so you are in it without being really in it! We were really happy the minute we walked in the doors. The overall look of the hotel is great! It feels like you fell into a little spot of SOHO NYC without the pretension. Service was top notch, gracious and fun! The bartenders are great and informative. The front desk helpful, and the mood is totally chill. The rooms are adorable and very clean. We stayed for 3 nights in October and we were are going back for more! NOLA has become my husband and my little hideaway, but I wouldn't hesitate to bring a child there. Our 5 year old would love it. The best hotel we have found in New Orleans so far!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yolablue35
Reviews.Content: I simply LOVE this hotel!! Excellent service and although i was there on business travel everyone at the hotel was accomodating. The food was simply excellent and I loved the location....in the business district but in walking distance of the French Qtrs....the staff provided great recommendations for food/shopping. I never slept so well in that king size bed....great viewsof the city if your lucky to get on the 5th fl or above. The room rate was amazing compared to other cities i've visited. I highly recommend this property for Business or personal...they have another property called Loft 123 that i would like to stay at on my next visit...start making your reservations for Mardi Gras 2012 and book at IH Hotel!! The city is simply FAB and the food is simply AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About the International House”
Reviews.Author: FSU2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited New Orleans several times over the last 10 years and this was the best hotel stay, thus far. Even though we were married in the French Quarter, we normally avoid staying in the downtown area. But, when I saw an $85 a night deal on SniqueAway, it was just too good to pass up. When we arrived at the hotel we noticed that staff do not wear uniforms or name tags. So, when someone standing at the door asks to assist you with your bags, it's not just some random guy trying to earn a little cash. The staff were super nice and hotel is a work of art. Our 10th floor room was immaculate. We could see the cruise ships from our room. The location is perfect for exploring by foot. It's only a few blocks away from Harrah's casino, Canal St., Bourbon St., and the shops along the river. Whatever you do, don't miss out on the hotel breakfast buffet. It's a simple selection of items, but well worth $10. We loved this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First time visit and it was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: gumbo60
Reviews.Content: Not knowing where to stay in New Orleans I asked a friend who lives there where would be a good place to stay and he recommended the International House. It was a great recommendation and we really enjoyed it. We will be back and now we know where to stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: katieaz
Reviews.Content: I was totally surprised at just how wonderful this hotel was. The lobby is elegant, romantic, yet homey. The staff are wonderful. The room very zen like and calming. Super clean. The room was not huge but large enough. Location is great, just on the margins of the Latin Quarter so nights were not crazy unless you wanted to take a brief walk to people watch. The hotel bar also provided plenty of opportunity for people watching but very serene and somewhat surreal at night with all the candle aglow. If you did not get breakfast with your room , call the hotel in advance of your stay and inquire about the breakfast add-on. The pre-arranged breakfast cost was ten bucks for two people per day for our stay. You can do this even if you have a Priceline Deal. If you add breakfast at arriveal I believe it was $15 per person. Don't hesitate to book here. If you need to be in N.O .you'll want to experience The International House.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome, excellent and we will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: baskets58
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came down for the" Sade" concert, it was great, great, great, but the hotel was awesome, amazing, fabulous. Never Have I seen such a wonderful Hotel. Everything about it was perfect, the room, customer service, food was fantastic. We will be back very soon like in a month.Great job to the staff, we loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want Romance, Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Absolutaries
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this as I lay in my comfy king sized bed on my last full day in NoLa. IHH is a GREAT hotel. From the perfect location to everything, to the bar with awesome drinks, to the lovely, accommodating staff, this is an awesome place to kick off your visit to NoLa. My hubby and I are here for our 6 year anniversary and everything about the hotel set the mood. Romantic, candlelit lighting throughout the hotel, soft linens in the room, thick fluffy towels in the bathroom - even the carpet beneath our feet is soft. The rooms are not sprawling, but sufficient - although the king bed is huge and lulls you to sleep. We are from Los Angeles where premium hotel accommodations are the norm and IHH meets the standard we are accustomed to. We will definitely stay here again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mneshaw
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at International House during Jazzfest in N.O. 4 of the last 5 years. The location is fantastic, on Camp St. a short block from Canal St and the entrance to the French Quarter for restaurants and night life. It's walking distance to the many great restaurants in the downtown business district. IH is a boutique hotel with a very cool atmosphere, a great lobby and very stylish bar. The rooms are medium size but quite comfortable with excellent beds.. The staff could not be more accommodating. If you're planning to attend Jazzfest the busses to and from the Fair are at the corner of Camp and Canal. It couldn't be any easier.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Judy154914
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and the front desk staff welcoming with answers to all "tourist" questions - from tours available to restaurants to hairdressers. The decor of the lobby made me want to spend as much time as possible there, especially in the evening when candles were lit and laughter from the lounges could be heard. I loved my room and could walk everywhere that, as a tourist, I wanted to. Great breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: attwema
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and accomodating. They provided information on all tourist activities and the-not-so-touristy activities that are available in New Orleans.
