They did everything from making restaurant reservations to hailing cabs. The hotel rooms were average size but very clean and comfortable, perfect for two people. The hotel location was conveniently located between the French Quarter and The Warehouse District, everything was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fancy40205
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and i stayed at the international house and were impressed with the dÃ©cor, lobby was gorgeous, and bar area was very intimate. The room has a beautiful long mirror and chandelier and the headboard of bed was very unique...made of leather and went about 10 feet up. The ceilings in the room were about 12 feet which made it feel very roomy. Also there is room service and a restaurant connected to the hotel. There was a nice appeal and had a great feel. Tyffanie Vial

Reviews.Title: “A Phenomenal Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AOzawa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were referred to this hotel, for her visit to Tulane. The small boutique hotel was in a wonderful location, only 2 blocks from the French Quarter and a short trolley ride up St. Charles to Tulane. We stayed in the Rock Star room and enjoyed it's history, high ceilings and spaciousness. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, accomodating in every way. Details were not missed-upon return from sightseeing, in the lobby, cool lemon water was waiting.! The only suggestion I have, is that the bathroom needs to have a fan. The shower steam took a bit to clear. We look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: abbooth1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cool. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and modern. We were able use public transportation right down the street which was essential for our visit. The hotel's staff went out of their way to help us with everything we needed. They really made it appoint to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: ecmvista
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels in New Orleans. We planned on staying for one night and then decided to stay another night. The service was excellent and the restaurant, Rambla was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel--great escape!”
Reviews.Author: Bebwheeler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to move around the entire city; nice to be out of the craziness but could definitely walk there easily. Best part for me was the Aveda toiletries--and i got new bottles everyday! Comfy bed, beautiful tiled bathroom. They are lovers of Apple products, so nice to be able to charge my iphone on the alarm since I left my charger at home. My only recommendation is to ask for a non-street room if you do want to sleep late; cars started honking pretty early. And I love the lobby, dimly lit and smelling fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel! Will definately be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Tammilton
Reviews.Content: The hotels is in a good location. The surrounding streets are actually quite and if you stay in the RockStar Room you will not hear anything from the outside. The staff are great! Brian at the Valet is top notch! The front desk staff were very accommodating and helpful. The bar is frequented by locals and tourist. I can't wait to come back to stay at this hotel! If you can find parking on the street, it is FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel--great location”
Reviews.Author: DDS01
Reviews.Content: Great location---2 blocks from the French Quarter but none of the noise/smell etc.15 min. brisk walk from convention centre.A couple of minutes from the casino Very attentive/helpful staff. Room a bit small for a King but very clean,quiet,nice bathroom (could use some hooks for towels near shower). Very good value for price. Buffet breakfast excellent value (book in advance)

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: saintsfanMS
Reviews.Content: IH is my favorite place to stay in New Orleans. Staff is always so very friendly and accomodating. We were actually upgraded to a Deluxe King room on our last night for no extra charge. Will always come back to IH!

Reviews.Title: “In town for a baseball tourney, decided to stay in NOLA for night life”
Reviews.Author: Katered
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit deflating after looking at their site. Great rate and location for the nights I stayed... a little confused about the dark, versus dim, lobby. I love rosemary mint so liked the smell of the candles burning. The evening staff was a bit abrupt and probably could use lessons in smiling and full eye contact. Weren't very helpful in suggesting dinner... I travel a bit for work and felt that staff was probably on the lower end of customer service. Maybe I expected too much. I ended up using Yelp after getting the twisted face, "I don't really eat around here" The bar tenders have yet to acknowledge us so we left. The room was appropriately dressed. Loved the Aveda products but the pillows were extremely soft so prepare to stack them. Loved the iHome alarm used in nicer hotels these days...I'd only stay here again if the rate is the same...

Reviews.Title: “All you can expect from a great luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabbianoverde
Reviews.Content: I got o New Orleans twice a year at least on business, always stay at the IH. Central, modern, classy and professional. Ex-cel-lent cocktails at the bar downstairs and very good food. Strongly recommended all-round.

Reviews.Title: “Change in management & Personnel...disappointed in check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: ChanzOut
Reviews.Content: This is probably my sixth (if not 7th) visit during the month of July. We are what I would consider regulars. Advised of our stay well in advance. With all the arrangements made there was a several hour delay with our check in. My thoughts is that every effort would be made to make sure everything was ready & waiting for our arrival. Very disappointed and the worse thing is that no one seemed to notice that there was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay and this one was not nearly as lovely as the others”
Reviews.Author: Batty5
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the International House Hotel. I have to say, after our last stay, I'm not sure I'll be returning. This hotel has a number of pluses: chic rooms, polite staff, nice restaurant and bar with creative drinks. However, I was very unimpressed with our stay in May. When we got into our room, the linens had not very obviously not been changed. Gross! We called housekeeping and they came up quickly to change them, but it was irritating since I was exhausted and wanted to take a nap. Later that evening, we went down to the bar for a drink where the "hip" waiters ignored us for about 15 minutes when we tried to order a drink. Then, I had to wait another 10 minutes or more for a glass of water and another 20 minutes for our check. The waiter was staring at me the whole time and knew I wanted to get his attention, but ignored me nonetheless. At checkout when we mentioned the above problems with our stay, all the staff did was offer an apology. He said that the maid, who apparently did not change any of the linens on our floor, was fired. He said he would mention the problems at the bar to the bar manager. This is an inexcusable way to apologize. At the very least, he should have comped the drinks from our bill and offered us a discount on our next stay. It makes me very angry as we are return guests. I understand that things like this happen, but the hotel needs to make this up to their guests, especially their returning guests. This is just bad business. We have a wedding in New Orleans and were thinking of staying here. I think that Loew's might be the better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Have a great time and are already talking about when to go back.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellerfromTo
Reviews.Content: We had a good time. The hotel was 1 Â½ short blocks from Canal street. Across that street is the French Quarter. It was close to everything, without being too close to the noise of Bourbon Street. The room was quite modern unlike some of the hotels in the quarter. So it was quite accessible. The trolley car was also available from Cancel Street. The room was always clean and not at all noisy. The shower area was roomy. The hotel staff was very helpful. I asked the front desk person for some help and they were very polite. The breakfast buffet was also very good. Only problem with the buffet was I have to go to the front desk to confirm that I had paid for the buffet for my entire stay. The buffet staff did not have that information. I loved the free computer in the lobby for when I did not remember the address of a restaurant. Quick and accessible. I would definitely stay there again. I even checked when I returned to see where they had other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hip bar, cool restaurant”
Reviews.Author: livetoeat86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend and was impressed. Loa bar in the lobby makes great cocktails. Rambla is a neat restaurant. Further, the lobby has great artwork and Devon at the front desk was very helpful and accomodating. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great NOLA hotel and bar”
Reviews.Author: Spookylilcajun
Reviews.Content: Friendly, knowledgeable staff and bartenders. Comfortable, clean and quiet rooms in a central location. We're going back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jenny496
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to New Orleans and stayed at the International House based on the recommendation of a friend. We were so glad we did and really enjoyed our stay there. The location is great. It's in the business district, just a block or two up from Canal Street. Everything in the French Quarter is within walking distance and most of the popular stops are just a 5 or 10 minute walk away. It's close to everything, without being too close to the chaos and noise of Bourbon Street. The staff at the International House was friendly and helpful. They were always available to help us out with directions or give us tips about the city. The rooms were very cute and modern. We had an upgraded room on the corner, that had windows all around. The bathroom was a little small, but clean and up-to-date. Our only complaint about the hotel was the noise. The walls were paper thin and you could hear everything that was going on outside, as if the windows were open. We were on the fourth floor, and there were times we could even hear people's conversations from the street. It made it hard to sleep, especially in the morning when the street cleaner truck came by. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay at the International House and would likely stay there again on our next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Bent over backwards to meet our needs - again.”
Reviews.Author: LawPrime
Reviews.Content: This is a followup to my review from several years ago. My wife and I have stayed at the IH probably 20 times over the 4 years our son was at Tulane. Our recent visit gathered even more family to celebrate his graduation. We needed space for a small reception at the last minute, and the IH staff found us just exactly what we needed. The location is perfect - just 2 blocks outside the Quarter (less noisy) and close to the trolley cars. The staff has low turnover and knows us by name. There are many excellent choices for cheap or expensive food within a block, including Rambla, which is the hotel's own very excellent tapas bar. We would not consider staying anywhere else when in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “First Class/Value/Location Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: palucciSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: My girlfirend and I were treated like royalty from the moment we parked our car in front of the location. The lobby is majestic and is the fit and finish of the entire property. The bar LOA mixes some incredible potions. The rooms are well adorned. The location is perfect. Quiet yet only a couple of blocks from the hustle and bustle. Great value for the experience! Will return without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this boutique hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fiberworm
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff... Wonderful atmosphere.... Trendy decor... We will return!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, cozy and comfortable. Will definitely be back to this stylish hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ramirez80
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New Orleans, and although it was for business, IH left me with a relaxing feeling. The staff are very nice, the rooms clean, cozy and stylish. Will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robby212
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an easy, relaxed laid-back vibe. Staff is helpful and very nice. Great location, just blocks from the French Quarter, the CBD and the warehouse district. Visit Bar Loa in the lobby for their craft cocktails, made with fresh ingredients.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at IHH!”
Reviews.Author: LShulkey
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful ambience & shoutout to Devin who gave excellent restaurant rec's. Will definitely be back (soon)!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite City hotel in the South”
Reviews.Author: worldwiden1
Reviews.Content: Been staying here since '94 and it gets better and better. I am a photojournalist and travel constantly. I know good from bad, my travels have made me quite picky, and this hotel is excellent. Rooms are simple chic, great high end photos of New Orleans culture and musicians everywhere, The Front desk is efficient yet takes the time needed to make one's stay as rewarding as possible. Lovely staff at bar that is great for guests as well as a watering hole for local sophisticates. (strong drinks) Bath amenities are top drawer.. Room service prompt. Corner rooms quite romantic. If in NY the rates would be double the cost of the International House. Did not eat at restaurant so cannot comment. Love It!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it.”
Reviews.Author: Santo04
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location. But beware of the good reviews on this and other sites, as well as the hotel website. The photos are deceptive. Most rooms don't have windows. The rooms with the windows are small and poorly appointed - for example, no ventilation system in the windowless bathroom, a counter not fully attached to the cabinet in the bathroom, just really poor workmanship and quality. For $159 a night, it should be a lot better. The International House positions itself as a sophisticated, luxury boutique hotel - it's not. It was raining and cold after returning from a jazz club around 11 pm on a Thursday night - we asked for Irish coffee at both bars - neither could accommodate. The bartender at the lobby bar smugly said that "bars" don't offer coffee drinks. Really? The restaurant bar said they were closing and didn't want to brew fresh coffee. Really - this is a luxury boutique hotel and they can't brew coffee for guests? They acted as if 11 pm was soooo late at night. During our stay we didn't ask for anything out of the ordinary, but it felt like all the responses were about why or how they couldn't or wouldn't accommodate requests. We asked for just a pot of coffee for room service - nope, you had to order a continental breakfast for much more if you wanted room service. Bottom line - it feels a little like a hotel scam. It's really just a mid-range, very average hotel - especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Say Hello to Matt in Loa from Thor”
Reviews.Author: thorhansen
Reviews.Content: Best bartender in NOLA! Matt makes the best cocktails, there is no need to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Such a unique hotel- stay here if you're sick of chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: MissTravelGal1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at International House during Jazzfest and couldn't have been happier with my experience. Everything from the bathroom to the lobby was simply gorgeous. Even the art was unique! The staff was helpful and friendly and the bar is amazing! They have a drink menu that rivals anything I have seen from New York to LA. The lobby is absolutely stunning- I love the huge ottoman in the center. The rooms were lovely. Yes, they're a bit smaller than you may find at your local Holiday Inn, but the bed was so comfortable, I could lived in it. We had plenty of light from the windows and enjoyed our dinner at the restaurant next door. The menu was really special, a Spanish-New Orleans fusion. I've stayed a few different hotels in New Orleans, but I will definitely be coming back to International House from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: Mcq4
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding staying for the first time at this hotel. Everything from the front desk to the towels were wonderful. The bar is one of the best I have ever visited....just beautiful with all the candlelight and the drinks were outstanding!! Rooms are minimalistic yet having everything you would want or need. Highly recommend this hotel and will return again when we go back to the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “International House-New Orleans/Loft 523 is the best!”
Reviews.Author: MissDemure
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the International House in October 2010 and Loft 523-a a sister property in April 2011. Both times we went were for a weekend getaway (we're from Lafayette, LA) At both locations, he staff was friendly, the beds were comfy and the price was good. Not to mention it was conveniently located in CBD and near the quarter. Both stays I got a good night's sleep which is unusual considering it is New Orleans! I'd highly recommend it to young couples, romantic getaway. Its a little too trendy for families with small kids but if your traveling with teenagers, they'll enjoy it. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again..”
Reviews.Author: dancingdays8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with some friends for Jazzfest and it was an unpleasant experience. The room I had was kind of dirty and pretty depressing. I barely had any space to put my clothes and practically lived out of my suitcase. The room was also pretty dark as the lighting was poor. the windows were locked which was annoying as I like a little fresh air when I'm sleeping. The shower was average at best but water pressure was low. One of my complaints was that my room was only cleaned once and the hotel was meager with towels. I also hated the elevator as it was quite slow. I also unfortunately ate at the restaurant one night and the food was pretty bad. They had a very unusual menu. As for the lobby, I don't think anyone every said hello to me or inquired if I need anything, including a Taxi which I had to get to go the airport. I guess the fact they saw me carrying a large suitcase out wasn't a hint, but I managed to grab a cab on Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant boutique hotel bargain”
Reviews.Author: TheLittlePea
Reviews.Content: This lovely building is a short stroll from the glorious madness of Bourbon Street and the heart of the French Quarter. Stylish decor in the lobby, bar and most importantly the rooms. We stayed in the Corner King room which had plenty of space (loved the high ceilings), a huge bed and a very nice bathroom. Everyone we dealt with in the hotel was helpful and pleasant. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Susanbp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our sons 6th birthday. The hotel staff was exceptional, they had cake, balloons, milk & cokes waiting in the room for us upon our arrival. It was so touching, not to mention, every staff member we saw at the hotel greeted him with birthday wishes all weekend. The accommodations were very cool & sophisticated, as well as comfortable & clean. Loa, the lobby bar had great, unique drinks. Rumba, the hotel restaurant, had an amazing breakfast & great tapas style dinner...my only slight complaint was they had nothing on the menu for children. Regardless, IH went over & beyond our expectations & made our trip fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel in an awesome city”
Reviews.Author: brigette_garbin
Reviews.Content: Absolutely immaculate hotel in a fantastic location. Only two blocks from the French Quarter and not far from Bourbon Street - close enough, but far away enough to be quiet when you wanted to go to bed! Beautiful room, (not sure if we got an upgrade, but it was worth 5 times more than what we paid for it!). Very helpful and friendly staff - special shout out to Nikki behind the front desk! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, best hotel of our month-long trip to America, in a wonderful and fun city.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor, great bar, great restaurant, great service, great long weekend.”
Reviews.Author: lacottages
Reviews.Content: Definitely start or end your evening at the lobby bar - old fashioned cocktails made to order or be adventuresome and let the talented bartenders hook you up with a delicious, fresh cocktail made with your liquor/s of choice. You will not be disappointed in the drinks or the fabulous decor - chandeliers and great furnishings for lounging with friends or a romantic interest. Rambla's food was great as well - get the gourmet popcorn as an appetizer or dessert. It was amazing. Room was clean, comfortable, well-appointed and spacious. Smart Water in rooms and available for purchase at $2 really helped us quench our JazzFest thirst. Staff was friendly and helpful! I highly recommend this stylish boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really average quality, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: anabugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February with my mom and sister in law. I don't know if the problem was just on our floor, but everyday we had some issue with the cleanness of the room. Waste baskets wouldn't be emptied, the room wasn't cleaned once, no towels or soap would be left. We complained a couple of times and got really average service at the front desk. We asked for extra towels one day and took over 1 hr to bring them. The rooms are really not very welcoming, feel very cold and dull. Beds are comfortable, and noise wasn't an issue as it is off the French Quarter. We asked to upgrade as we weren't very fond of the room, and were very confused when we went into the room since there was a present for some guy there, a little cake. Apparently he didn't like the room either and changed, but they still delivered the cake to the old room. While we were on the phone trying to change rooms, we were told by the front desk there are rooms with no windows, so make sure you ask, unless you like that kind of thing. The location is pretty good, as you get quiet but at the same time you are steps away from the action. Breakfast was ok. All in all, it was just an ok stay, nothing memorable. If I ever go back to New Orleans I would probably like to try something else.

Reviews.Title: “very posh!!”
Reviews.Author: melodieterry75150
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the international house during the summer of 2010 and loved it! this place is posh for sure! the service is great and the restaurant is fab! the only drawback is that they charged my credit card for $75.00 for 2 days of parking my car in their garage, and didn't bother to tell me until after. the french quarter is the most crazy place i have ever seen, and is full of great culture,great food,great people,and great music!!! but be prepared for the crazy hunidity! you are soaked allll day!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, boutique hotel, greeted us with candlelit lobby - Everything exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Wineylips
Reviews.Content: My recent visit to New Orleans I stayed 5 nights at the beautiful International House in New Orleans. It exceeded my expectations! The hotel is a beautiful ,chic, boutique style hotel just across Canal Street from the French Quarter. A great location! A candle lit lobby greeted us upon late arrival. Winter white (taupe) colors with great red accent furniture and fantastic art adorned the walls of the lobby and magnificent lighting fixtures. Great decor, candle lit lobby made for a romantic feel upon arrival and every evening as you return to your hotel to call it a night. The Bar was bright by day and candlelit in the evening. The wellness breakfast was only $10 per room per day, when you book online in advance! The staff were magnificent! They were very friendly, attentive, and personable. A shout out to Jerry at the door, Chris at Rambala and everyone else that made our stay so enjoyable! Can't wait to return to NOLA and International House. We'd go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel style and comfort at its best”
Reviews.Author: JadeMcQueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The International House Hotel this past weekend and loved it! It was my first time in New Orleans and I did not get a chance to do much planning prior to my arrival. Upon my arrival at the hotel, I was greeted by the super friendly staff at the hotel which gave me great ideas and pointers onto what to do, where to eat and where to shop within my budget. My room was very comfortable and my bed better then any Starwood heavily bed. The bar was beautiful and easy to get into. The Wall Street journal was offered every morning and the room included a modern and roomy bathroom with Aveda shampoos and soaps, my favs. The gym is clean and open 24 hours. I also loved the fact that this hotel is located a block or so away from The French Quarter. Close enough to get to all the attractions but also quiet when you need to just relax. The rest of my friends stayed at The Ritz Carlton and thought I had a way better deal then they did! This place has everything you would need for a comfortable and stylish stay, it's an incredible value and I can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: trinitymills
Reviews.Content: We come to New Orlenas often for weekend getaways and like to try different hotels. My criteria are: good location, New Orleans ambience, buildings with a sense of history. International House fits all three. This may be as close to perfect a stay as I've had. It is located in a beautiful Beaux Arts building (formerly a bank and later the New Orleans World Trade Center) in the CBD, a straight shot across Canal Street to Jackson Square and the French Quarter. The interior is modern and historic all at the same time with incredible soaring ceilings, impressive chandeliers, baroque, furniture and candles EVERYWHERE. The room decor, however, is minimalist to the point of starkness (at least imo). The color scheme is a little too neutral (needed some color somwhere) but very restful and luxurious: comfortable bed with padded headboard, high ceilings with ceiling fan, deep pile carpet, 50" flat screen TV, Aveda bath products, thick monogrammed towels. The staff was very friendly, the rate was good. The bar is lovely and there is a nice little tapas restaurant on property. Some people miight say the hallways were a little too dim and the style a little too "hip," but I love that. While there is a small refrigerator in the room, there is no coffee maker. I didn't mind; I'm not a coffee drinker, but it struck me as odd for a hotel of this caliber. The onlhy downer for me was the valet parking fee ($32 a day, which is high even in New Orleans CBD/FQ). I would stay here again and try parking in the garage across the street to shave $10 a day off parking.

Reviews.Title: “NO AC - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: RoughneckFan
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning in the room. The room did not cool off, after phoning and complaining about the AC a technician did come and look at it at 11:30 PM - still 80 deg in the room all night. Upon check out we were offered a credit to be used at a later date, we asked for a reduction in our bill since we won't be going back to NOLA anytime soon but they could only offer a credit which they would mail to us because we had paid for the room in full and in advance (thanks Expedia). Also there are no ice machines on the floors, no in room coffee and a cold box (not a refrigerator) in the room. We phoned for a pot of coffee it was $18.00, which included a $4.00 built in tip. Room was very small, had to put a suite case in the closet, there was no table in the room so we set up the ironing board for that pupose as there was no where to put the tray the coffee came on.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned & really enjoyed our stay at IH”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip o NOLA & are planning to return next year. Firstly, let me say that we aren't really drinkers. We drink, but its not a focus for us. Travel is however & we ended up really loving N.O. not only because of the awesome food, but the people really were super friendly & welcoming! For us; Bourban Street was way overrated & it 's pretty disgusting in that it's as close as you can get to being a red light district. Add blind drunks, people throwing up/the smell of vomit, wedding parties dancing down the street with strippers wearing next to nothing at all in doorways & you get the picture. Most New Orleans residents aren't spending time there. My advice is that you do something way more useful like: going to a plantation or a museum, or on a tour & learning about the history of the region you are visiting. International House: its very modern & reminded me of an upscale boutique in LA or NY & maybe that is why we picked it. Rooms were clean and neat. No coffee makers (very sadly) but a small fridge you can stock any way you like. One thing they don't have is food 24/7. So, you'd better order your breakfast (& caffeine fix of choice) by 10AM or look elsewhere. Rambla, the tapa's place in the lobby is excellent however & we were sad we didn't get their menu in our room as we loved it & only discovered it the last day. The staff: very friendly & helpful & in many cases went out of their way to help us set up tours, make reservations or directions anywhere. With all that in mind I think doing a little homework before you go is always prudent, wherever you travel to so you know what you want to see before you hit the ground running. We were curious about Burboun Street so we did it the first night & about 10 minutes in we were done. Royal Street: with its antique shops is a nicer, quieter walk & much more enjoyable. Tours: Grayline, VIP & others. Of all of them I liked Grayline the best. They have big, clean buses that will take you out to the plantations (about 1 hours 15 minutes away) & the drivers are professional & knowledgeable. VIP Tours: was touted in our hotel as being "great" but we didn't think so. They pick you up. Gotta love that, but that's about where it ended. We drove all over the city, at the end of our trip which was a mistake as we had mostly gotten the lay of the land & its better to do it before you get going. We did drive into the 6, 7th & 9th wards though & saw the homes that were destroyed there still, but mostly new homes (contracted by Brad Pitt reportedly who is only charging cost to get into one. What a guy!) have been built & things are looking up as some have solar panels & most are on stilts, which makes much more sense! We drove around the Garden District with it's lovely homes where Sandra Bullock & John Goodman, among others live. Also, Commander's Palace is there & we thought it had the best food of any where. Ghost tours: this is very popular & we did one on a Sunday afternoon that covers the Garden district. We thought it nothing to rave about & was, of course, allot of stories told by locals that the guides learn & pass on although our guide had 1 story of her own. The Food: is awesome but stay out of "the quarter" as it's all tourist food there, except of course K. Pauls/Paul Prudhomme's place. He's a legend. Commander's palace ditto. Chop House we heard was wonderful, can't remember the chef's name but he's very famous. The Palace, just up the street from IH has good food but nothing awesome, however the jazz (on Sunday's not sure on other days) really made it much better!

Reviews.Title: “MODERN BEAUTY WITH A THE GLITZ AND SHINE”
Reviews.Author: melaniefh0205
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and stayed for our anniversary weekend which is also Halloween weekend as well... The hotel is like a decadent cake... beautiful decor and amazing chandeliers if your into eye pleasing ambiance. I feel in love with the hotel as soon as I walked in. Our room was very nice as well... don't let me get started on the bathroom... it was gorgeous. On arrival we were given to complimentary drinks at the Lola bar. I have to say out of NOLA they make the best Pim's cup... they use lavender I think that is the trick. The location is only a few blocks from the French quarter so if you are looking for a short walk away from the hustle and bustle this a perfect hotel for a romantic quiet stay. I'm going to try their sister hotel next Loft 523!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs99
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, stylish decor. Friendly staff. Helpful arranging a swap tour which was a highlight. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Service oriented chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: akzaddie
Reviews.Content: Upscale service oriented hotel in a very convienent location. Hot spot bar with lots of action. Rooms are well appointed and very clean. Terrific bed and large bathroom with stall shower. Over all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: secasra
Reviews.Content: Of thousands of stays, this was one of the very few hotels where staff regularly greeted me by name. I was personally welcomed each time I walked in the door - even more than at home! The superb staff helped me arrange many reservations for dinner, music or a tour, and always checked in to see how I enjoyed it. Yes, the rooms are lovely, shower nice and large, lobby elegant, breakfasts yummy, proximity to French Quarter ideal. But it's the amazing staff, especially Nikki DeB, that make this hotel extra special.

Reviews.Title: “first class service at Loa lounge”
Reviews.Author: eastvancity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at IH Hotels sister property (Loft 523). While in town, I discovered the IHâ€™s Loa Lounge, a true gem of a spot. Loa is a great reprieve from the chaos of nearby Bourbon St, though not lacking for a second in its own character and charms. The gals behind the Loa bar fix up some of the best cocktails to be found, delivered with a healthy dose of warm southern hospitality and sharp whit. The Roosevelt lounge and other old watering holes may justly lay claim to the origins of the sazerac and it's NO brethren, but it's the Loa gals who have these things truly wired. Great drinks, beautiful space and truly first class folk.

Reviews.Title: “Finest staff, services and comfort ever.”
Reviews.Author: kelbake
Reviews.Content: Niki, Jerry, John were extremely helpful in all aspects of our stay, and although I did not get to meet Amy Rheimer (sic) without her help this trip may never have happened. I couldn't thank the staff enough for an awesome trip to the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Could be so much better.”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend and were underwhelmed. I had stayed here 10 years previous when the hotel had just opened and it was so much better then. The lobby is pretty, the location is great, literally just outside the Quarter. The bar is lovely, although it takes about two years to get a drink - we went on three seperate nights and it was the same every night. The rooms though are so bland and blah, its depressing. Beige is the overwhelming theme. We were in one of the PH rooms and there was next to no place to put our clothes which was odd. No drawers. Very little room to hang things. The desk was dinky and literally no other surface area in the room beyond the tiny desk. Most of our clothes lived folded in piles on the floor for our stay. Nothing on the walls. It was just so bland. It was very clean - I will give them that! We looked at another room, that had a better closet situation on a lower floor, but that room was so clausterphobic as to be completely depressing - we ran back to our original room. The other depressing point as that one night we asked the concierge for a good recommendation for dinner in the Faubourg since we didn't know that area of town well and the place he directed us to was the most soulless, Friday's looking kind of place. We got there, turned around, jumped in a cab and went to Dick and Jenny's on the other side of town. For a great city like New Orleans, I expect more from a hotel like the International House.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric Design - Lame Service”
Reviews.Author: VeryVenice
Reviews.Content: The International House is in a great location, just across Canal Street. The decor is very trendy and atmospheric. But something was lacking at this hotel. When we arrived, no one was at the door to help with luggage. Not even a cart. They also messed up our reservation, so when we arrived it wasn't on the books. We needed a late check out because my husband was sick and they couldn't allow it without charging us for another day. Overall, it was fine for 2 nights, but don't expect any service.

Reviews.Title: “a short stay in the big easy”
Reviews.Author: TopangaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel especially of you don't want to be in the French Qtr - which we didn't. Great staff that helped us with dinner ideas. We loved the tapas restaurant next door and hanging out in the bar off the lobby. Being an older hotel (that's been refurbished), it still has single pane windows that don't adequately keep out the street noise. It was no problem asking to have our room switched to a quieter side of the hotel. But the best part of this hotel is Jerry. I don't want to call him the door man because he was so much more. Besides knowing everything about the city he was just great to hang out with. The day we left, he set up our cab ride to the airport that included a 2 hr detour through the areas hit hardest by Katrina.

Reviews.Title: “A cool, serene vibe in the middle of a raucous, good time city”
Reviews.Author: sjkMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights and felt like this was our own private retreat. The rooms are lovely and decorated with atmospheric black and white jazz photographs. The breakfasts were affordable, healthy and delicious. The bar and lobby were buzzing with interesting looking people each night. It was so nice to be able to walk out the door and be in the Quarter in a matter of minutes or stroll to museums and restaurants close by. The staff were all quite friendly and helpful. This place is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Just Because You Book a Room Does Not Mean They Will Have One”
Reviews.Author: lcsmd
Reviews.Content: I can not really tell you much about the rooms as I never got to see one. I arrived at 2:30 and was told that check-in was not until 4:00 and my room was not ready. It was suggested that I walk around for a while which I did. When I returned at 4pm, I was nonchallantly told that my room was not available and they had booked me into the La Quinta next door. When I inquired as to whether or not they had called any other hotels, they said they had and they were all booked. As I found it hard to believe, I went online and found that there were many equivalent rooms available. I do not enjoy being lied to. If any of you have stayed at a La Quinta, you know it is a very different type of hotel than what I was anticipating. To add insult to injury, the La Quinta informs me when I ask that the International House does this "not infrequently." Book at your own risk unless you enjoy booking a 4 star hotel and staying at a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: parkbench28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while in NOLA for a conference. Rather than pay a ridiculous sum for the conference hotel, I decided to try out a boutique hotel that looked like it would be a different experience than I was used to. This was a great hotel. Very nice rooms, huge and modern bathrooms, and a fabulous bar downstairs. Lovely people working there, as well. It also is a very short walk to the main streets of the quarter, which makes the hotel all the better.

Reviews.Title: “Have you check their bar?”
Reviews.Author: cindyalamo
Reviews.Content: probably if you are like me you will find this review refreshing because is from a different perspective, let me explain: of course for me the hotel (general areas) and room are a very important features BUT, i look for a nice "bar area" as well, why? because after a very looong day walking and shopping i think we deserve a nice drink to relax, and you know what? the bar in this hotel is very cozy, elegant, great service and with the class usually tourist places in New Orleans lack. Prices are high as expected in a place like this but they worth it, for example i usually drink black label on the rocks with a splash of mineral water, well, they serve what i consider a double or even a triple shot every time and a little bottle of mineral water on a side, so you receive what you paid for. Even just to stop and have a drink here i think is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “IH made my first stay in NO memorable.”
Reviews.Author: ateach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came into NO the morning after Fat Tuesday expecting to see a mess around the city and at the hotel. This was not the case at the hotel. Walking into the lobby of overstuff seating areas, crystal chandeliers and candles everywhere was wonderful. At the small check-in desk a smiling young lady quickly process our reservation and we headed up to the 9th floor. The corner room was spacious and decorated in what I would call high end shabby chique. The shower was huge, the view out the 6 windows great, the bed was very comfortable. Our 3 night stay was enjoyable. Here are few other things we noted during our stay. There is no good place to park near by. The entrance is right on the street with about 2 car spaces used to handle guests coming and going. So if you have a car, be prepared to pay for expensive valet parking. The men who work the front entrance were friendly and efficient. This was true for all of the staff. Also, guests do not have access to an ice machine. I thought this would be a problem, but all I had to do was contact the front desk and a huge bucket of ice was delivered immediately. Another item...noise from the street can be heard even on the 9th floor, but things quieted down late at night and I had no problem sleeping. We opted for the Wellness Breakfast when I made the reservation. At $10 per day for 2 it seemed like a good deal. However, on the first morning, the buffet was out of eggs, sausage, bacon and fruit. About 15 minutes later, the eggs and fruit were refilled but we were told that there was no more bacon or sausage. This was at 9 AM. We went out for breakfast the next morning. On our third and last morning, it was scrambled eggs again, no sausage and an emptly fruit bowl. The coffee station was well maintained and the coffee very good. Other reviewers mentioned that they enjoyed the bar and resturant. We felt both were cold and expensive. There are many bars and resturants within easy walking distance that we enjoyed more, like Luke's. This hotel is located within easy walking distance to the French Quarter, street car stops, Harrah's and more.The staff was outstanding, the best I have experienced during years of travel and staying at all kinds of hotels. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Locals can sometimes be the harshest critics, but you guys lived up to the best standards.”
Reviews.Author: Buckup
Reviews.Content: From the front desk clerks who asked smart questions and accomodated every request, to the housekeepers who obliged our delays and extra requests, to the valet service that helped whisk us away from the maddening crowds, everyone at the hotel helped to make a very highly favorable opinion of your hotel, most especially from our local kids who now live away. That's the way to enhance future business. Thank you for delivering a good service in a town that everybody wants to visit. Maybe you guys should take over the taxi service in this town.

Reviews.Title: “My first hotel choice while staying in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Robin36608
Reviews.Content: International House is in a great location. The staff is frienly and helpful. Great ambiance! Great bar! Love it! I always recommend IH to anyone making a trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kljames02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the International House while in New Orleans to celebrate a friend's bachelorette weekend. The hotel was great! The decor was stunning and the rooms were neat and clean. The staff was very helpful. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would stay at this hotel again the next time I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: wowme1
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I visited this hotel for Bayou Classic weekend and we loved it. The modern decor took my breath away first and then it was the room. Im into decorating so the styles used were to die for. The service was great and they even have a bar in the lobby. It was just walking distance from everything. Its a must stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place was all they said and more!”
Reviews.Author: kaci8595
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived the front desk was amazing. We had our bags unloaded and the vehicle parked for our entire stay. Our room was small but every room i have stayed in in new orleans is. The lobby was very nice. Very calm atmosphere. We were never bothered & when we had questions they were answered with friendly smiling faces. We traveled with our 2 young children & the front desk treated them as if we had known them our whole lives. They made the kids first trip one they will remember. Thank you so much for our wonderful get away cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel with Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: doctorrj
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a group of friends when we traveled to New Orleans for a Bachelorette party. The hotel lobby is gorgeous! Although the rooms were a little on the small side, they were nicely appointed. I also thought the staff were very helpful, especially Nikki (I hope that I'm remebering her name correctly) at the front desk. The hotel was also in walking distance to the French Quarter. It is convenient to everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are traveling to the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roberta_dee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous from the front door to the top floor. The doorman, (Jerry was our favorite, but all are fabulous,) wad well versed in New Orleans culture and cuisine. The front desk staff were friendly and hospitable. The lobby and room was absolutely fabulous and extremely clean. The location is awesome...... Within walking distance to Bourbon St. and many yummy restaurants. Can't wait to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Batty5
Reviews.Content: The International House is a lovely boutique hotel. I've stayed here twice with my husband. The location is great: minutes away from the Quarter and the Canal St shops. The staff is friendly and recommends great restaurants. Definitely have a drink at their bar, their cocktails are quite good and creative. Also, the restaurant connected with the hotel, Ramblas, is great, especially if you arrive late. My sole complaint is that the beds are not that comfortable. However, the down comforters are a nice touch. Also, the lighting in the bathrooms is not great. Finally, they should have free wifi at this price. I hope to stay here again, as it is one of my favorite New Orleans hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,clean and comfortable room with happening bar and resturaunt”
Reviews.Author: batty325
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our first stay here during a busy weekend just before Mardi Gras madness really takes over New Orleans. Nice room of average size with large bathroom(shower only). Comfortable bed but could have used a couple of extra pillows on bed. Small boutique hotel with typical amenitites- did like the Aveda bath products. Only problem was that we ordered coffee to be delivered at 7am as we had to leave early and it never showed. When I called front desk they were not very helpful. Said I could get coffee in the lobby- which cost $7. for two cups !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kstan2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Mardi Gras for a girls' weekend. Once we were able to actually get to the hotel (streets were blocked for a parade), things were great. The room was comfortable and spacious. It's modern. I absolutely loved the bathroom in the room! It was huge! The hotel lobby and lounge area were decorated beautifully. We took lots of pictures. We also valeted the car with ease. It was a very nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Service. Clean & Quiet. Superb Deco.”
Reviews.Author: letetz
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at International House. It is conveniently located in the French Quarter and walking distance to popular spots in the French Quarter. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, nice decor--just don't look too close.”
Reviews.Author: stlogan
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay in New Orleans at International House, but I can see how it would not be for everyone. The decor is unique, particularly the lobby, and our room on the 3rd floor was nice. The staff was extremely friendly and always ready with a suggestion, map, or even concert tickets when we happened by at the right time. The hotel bar and restaurant are also nice. A quick walk from the French Quarter and trolley stops for pretty much anywhere else you'd like to go, the location is nice. We liked being near the quarter but not IN the quarter since we were apparently the least partying people in NOLA. There is free wifi and our room had a flat panel tv, robes, and plenty of towels and pillows. I would stay here again. You should be aware that there are some issues with this hotel (and maybe all NO hotels since the buildings are old, even though this has been renovated). The design of the hotel and the rooms is nice, but the execution in our room was a bit lacking if you looked really closely--the floor under the carpet was uneven, feeling as if there was just plywood stuck on top of the floor in spots, the carpet was pulling up at the transition to the bathroom and near a wall, and there were some flaws with tile installation in the bathroom as well--basically, it seemed as if they paid the designers well but the installers poorly. I have to say that I did not really mind any of this because I got an excellent rate for the room; had I paid the published rate for the room I might have been upset. It did not impact our comfort (bed linens were of good quality and there was a down comforter) in any way, and the room was clean, but if you expect everything to be perfect you will be disappointed. It was also COLD during our stay. Old windows are not great for keeping out the unseasonable cold weather, but we just pulled the drapes, turned up the heat, and turned on the ceiling fan. I tried to find the "odor" other reviewers complained of but never experienced it.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating and the perfect distance from the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Bernie21NYC
Reviews.Content: When you book a weekend getaway just 5 days in advance, you don't expect to get much more than a roof over your head. But we were lucky enough to land a 2-night stay at the International House during the first weekend of Mardi Gras! The hotel is not long on character and goes more for downtown chic than old school New Orleans, but it was clean, well-located, and run by a helpful and informed staff. While they didn't know where the closest bike rental was, they provided helpful information about the city and Mardi Gras celebrations. The hotel was just one block from Canal which separates CBD from the French Quarter, so were actually centrally located to walk to the FQ, Garden District, and to the waterfront. The cozy hotel bar was also a nice convenience for pre-dinner drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Imcompetent, Rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleyjb
Reviews.Content: I have been to luxury hotels all over the US an have never been treated like IH did me. Took over an hour to get checked in due to my name being banned to stay at that hotel. You would think that with a name like Ashley, which is obviously very common, that they would'nt give me a hard time checking in for such a reason. I for one, have never even stayed at this hotel before in my life. I don't even have a parking ticket on my record. They also noted that I used different addresses when booking the room. Hello?! Can I not own a house in one state, and rent an apartment in another when I move for work? Seems like excuses to not want me to stay there? All of this trouble while paying for a below average penthouse suite ($1000). It didn't even have a wet bar, just a bed and a couple of chairs. Last time I checked this is not the only hotel in New Orleans. Don't ever have to worry about banning me, I will never step into IHH or any hotel in the K group ever again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favorite Hotels in this Great City”
Reviews.Author: CamiCan
Reviews.Content: Historic building, the essence of New Orleans. In walking distance of the French Quarter if you want to do the touristy thing and a short ride to Uptown if you want to hang with locals. Fantastic place to stay - support the locals!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, value”
Reviews.Author: BooZoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit NOLA once a month. We'll probably stay at International House 8 or 9 of those occassions. Modern decor, great bar, solid restaurant, nice staff. The lower-end rooms are smallish, but still comfortable. Close enough to the Quarter (2 blocks) without the aggravation of actually staying in the Quarter. Rates are generally substantially lower than comparable hotels. No pool, but you're in New Orleans....I prefer to cool off in an air-conditioned barroom.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly delightful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: angeledarling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made last minute reservations in order to attend a function in New Orleans. A friend had recommended the International House and we were completely taken by the friendly staff, creative and european-style decor that is modern and at the same time warm and old-world. Had dinner at the restaurant, Rambla, with ten friends and enjoyed wonderful tapas and in the morning a beautiful breakfast buffet. We found the restaurant to be a bargain in every way. Great room, while smaller than some, perfectly appointed with great linens and neutral and soothing decor. We would highly recommend this to anyone seeking a great New Orleans hotel. Our only disappointment was not to be able to grab a cocktail or glass of wine on our arrival as the bar did not open until four.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lpo1
Reviews.Content: I was really excited for this hotel. The photos look incredible. The lobby is really pretty, as is the lounge/bar. But everything else was really lacking. The rooms are simple and lack the personality and/or style you expect from a boutique hotel. The cleaning service missed, continually, a splatter of some brownish red substance above the shower (blood? hair dye? It was gross). They also didn't feel the need to knock prior to entering, even with the sign on the door. Also, one night I entered the hotel, the doorman was missing, and someone had spilled what I hope was chilli (and not vomit) all over the door handle. Ugh. The front desk was the worst of both worlds-- unfriendly and incompetent. They don't have a business center but offered to print some things for me-- but then couldn't figure out how to do it. The fitness center is tiny. There was a ban on drinking New Orleans water while I was there, but nobody notified me of this, or brought water bottles as one would expect as a courtesy. I had really thought staying in this hotel would make a week-long conference trip much more pleasant, but it just didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for great value, excellent staff, clean rooms ,central location.”
Reviews.Author: BVR94501
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to visit NOLA but our usual B&B in the French Quarter was booked(getting very costly) so we decided on staying at the International House. We were pleasently surprised at the price but most of all, we were impressed by the staff who were professional, extreemly helpful and went out of their way to make our stay wonderful ,especially Brian, Angela and Jerry. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. The hotel is centrally located to the French Quarter and fine restaurants. IH has two great bars and a restaurant. Looking foward to our next visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Looking but that's all...”
Reviews.Author: teddyjane
Reviews.Content: Things you get (staying in the penthouse)...Pretty decor, shared patio, 2 chairs and bed, open shower and cool bathtub, a price tag that is almost double what other hotels charge for comparable rooms, french quarter adjacent, vending machines. Things you DON"T get (again in the penthouse) friendly staff, good service, curtains that block light, a mini bar, room service (they claim to have it but seem put out to do it...ps breakfast is from 7-8:30 am and it's a hassle to even get a cup of coffee) valet, doorman or bellman most of the time, common courtesy. We planned to stay for a week and left after 2 days...they manager did apologize and offered us a lower rate and free breakfast but the concept of southern hospitality (or any hospitality) seems to be lost on this place...it seems none of the staff is local, the room was pretty but we felt very unwelcome and without room service and the hefty price tag it was a no brainer to change hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has moments of being nice, but they don't go out of their way.”
Reviews.Author: DMillerLaw
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday afternoon and room was ready, clean and overall quite nice. It faced the street, and outside noise could be heard on the 9th floor. Saturday morning was the last day that I had hot water. Saturday evening it was lukewarm; Sunday morning ice cold. I asked at the front desk Sunday afternoon, they said the hotel was at capacity so sometimes "that happens." It was pouring rain and I wanted a hot bath Sunday evening and they assured me it was fixed. It was not. It wasn't ice cold, but the water was barely warm. Monday morning, ice cold water again. When I checked out, I again told the front desk. First she questioned if I had told anyone and I was the only complaint she had received. Then she called the maintainence guy who said I was "wrong" as the pilot light was now fixed (huh?!) The front desk woman explained the wind had blown out the pilot light to the hot water heater, but it was fixed now. Still no sorry, no discount on the bill, no nothing. Just "too bad, next time that shouldn't be a problem." Meanwhile, my boyfriend had come down 45 minutes prior to give them his ticket for the car. The car was still not there. We waited another 25 minutes and after several inquiries, they "found" our car. Only after they also realized they forgot to give us the ticket for it. That all left a bad taste in our mouth, but it got worse a week later. My boyfriend had used his debit card for the room. The bill had been paid in full, yet the hotel still had a $1000 "hold" on his card that was tying up his funds. Again, bill paid in full, we had checked out a week prior, no damage, no extra charges. Just this hold. Upon contacting the hotel-repeatedly-they said the hold "can" be there for up to 90 days. Why do they need to do that if we've paid in full? No explanation. Overall, the nice room and comfortable bed was completely overshadowed by the level of customer service and lack of hospitality, not to mention bad business practices.

Reviews.Title: “The only place for us in the Big Easy.”
Reviews.Author: marielalaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is intimate and showcases the beauty and art of New Orleans as soon as you walk through the door. The staff is polite and personable with excellent customer service as they greet everyone walking through the lobby at all times. The rate is unbelievably reasonable for the quality of the facility. The location is close enough to the French Quarter without being completely submerged in the noise and crowds. When planning a trip to New Orleans, this is the only hotel I consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel w/style and location!”
Reviews.Author: Dixie
Reviews.Content: Forget about staying near Bourbon Street. It's a zoo. The CBD is a much better location and only blocks from the French Quarter. The International House has a lovely/stylish lobby, excellent service and beautiful rooms. We stayed on the penthouse floor in a king room and had a great view of the city! The room was not large but very contemporary and comfortable. Our room had beautiful furnishings and a very comfortable bed, flat screen TV and a photo of Dr John! The bathroom was huge and quite beautifully decorated. You will not be sorry if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrSmith12
Reviews.Content: I was taking a trip with friends to enjoy this event entitled "Bayou Classic". I got to the hotel and was blown away with the scenery. Very elegant atmosphere and the staff was the best. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to visit New Orleans. The hotel is seconds from Canal and Bourbon Street. You will get your money's worth with this place!!

Reviews.Title: “High ceilings, diffused light, cute bar, right by French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: AnnBKim
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and nice; it had high ceilings and big tall windows. The tapas restaurant, Ramblas that was attached to the hotel seemed to have good food: didn't eat there, but saw what was out for the breakfast buffet. I had drinks downstairs which were very well made.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously mislead - not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveler00253
Reviews.Content: The room smelled musty and not attractive at all. The window had a crack in it which allowed cold air to come into the room. We awoke one morning and couldn't take a shower because the hot water went out!! The breakfast was terrible. The food was cold, the ham was like shoe leather! The restaurant closes every day from 2~5pm which means if you want a cup of coffee or tea (heaven forbid you're hungry) you are out of luck! I was not feeling well and asked for a cup of tea and was told "sorry the restaurant is closed until 5pm". Mind you, the restaurant was located right next to the front desk and I could walk in and see the chefs in the kitchen!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location, fantastic bar”
Reviews.Author: DianeHL
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Thanksgiving weekend and had a great time. International House is only two blocks from the quarter, which is just enough distance to drown out the noise. The room was spacious and clean. The fitness center has everything you need. The front desk staff was happy to provide recommendations and they were quick bringing the car out of valet!

Reviews.Title: “Delicious hotel in a delicious city!!”
Reviews.Author: jod925
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit New Orleans when our trip to Paris was cancelled and we were delighted. I had read about the International House Hotel in a travel magazine and we decided to try it - and we were just delighted!! Everything about the hotel was terrific. The folks at the front desk were helpful and knowledgeable - and they sent us to some delicious restaurants. The room was lovely - tasteful, elegant and very comfortable. The location of the hotel was ideal -- not in the French Quarter, but very near by. All in all, we loved New Orleans - we plan to come back and hope to stay at the International House again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hip accommodations”
Reviews.Author: WinifredS
Reviews.Content: Came to NO for the Photonola photography conference and were thrilled with the International House. Everyone was helpful and we loved the adjoining tapas bar.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly luxurious with a downtown hipster vibe”
Reviews.Author: littlebrowngirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this cute hotel near the French Quarter on a solo trip to NOLA during Thanksgiving. Beautiful corner room with floor to ceiling windows, tufted king headboard and a glorious wall mirror and chandelier. Will visit again soon, and will stay at this fantastic property. The adjacent bar, Loa, was fantastic as well with friendly bartenders and great cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Staff excels near the French Quarter, only wish they had coffee!”
Reviews.Author: csmfll
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the International House kicked off to a great start even before it began. Greg in reservations went above and beyond before we even arrived. He took personal interest in trying to work within our budget given the holiday season (although many of the even more luxurious hotels with more amenities offered very low rates for the same time period). Nicholas at the front desk should win a gold star award for excellence in personalized customer service. Within one day he learned our travel and dining tastes and every single suggestion he's offered (and he has given us many with the utmost patience and insider insight) hit the mark spot on. He is truly the best asset this hotel offers, and they are very fortunate to have him. The decor is elegantly charming in a streamlined kind of way. We do wish there were a minimum of coffee and tea service at the hotel since the restaurant is closed and with the holidays, many businesses including dining options are closed. We expected that a boutique hotel would at least offer a hot beverage in the morning so we wouldn't have to step out in the bitter cold to start our day, and I hate to admit for my mom, this is a deal breaker. We hope the contract with the Rambla isn't for too long and that the coffee/tea/pastry/fruit offerings will be restored, especially during holidays when so many dining establishments are closed you want the convenience of your hotel to offer the basics. Housekeeping somehow failed to come to our room after our first night but the front desk felt terrible. The hotel offers an excellent quiet location adjacent the French Quarter, extremely friendly and genuinely kind staff and a good (not excellent) value. Also loved to music and we look forward to the rest of the hotel "coming to life" tomorrow for the balance of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: careahh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by my boss. I am the sales manager at a hotel in Lafayette, so I know the type of service to expect and I wasn't disappointed. My boyfriend and I chose the "rock star room". It was small, but the lack of windows meant that when we stumbled in from the casino around 6am, we got amazing sleep. And the 12 noon check out was a blessing as well. The front desk staff were prompt and courteous, and we had a great time at the bar with our bartender Kori. (I believe that was her name). I will definitely be returning to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a great bar in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: dannybreaux
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'Rockstar' room of the hotel, which was pitch black. After staying out for a long night it was quite nice not to wake up with the sun shining in your eyes. The hotel was elegant and had a great cocktail bar in the lobby. Service was good and the price was affordable. Since we come to New Orleans every couple of months to get out of the hometown this is now our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice hotel with some bad rooms - be careful which one you get”
Reviews.Author: Norstar69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located only a few minutes walk from Canal Street and the Charles Street tram, but be very careful which room you get because unfortunately, we were given two very poor rooms on the first night, which were not as described on the Hotel website and without "luxuries" such as curtains... We booked a Queen double deluxe room through Expedia. On the hotel website, the room is shown with tall windows with curtains, a queen double bed and desk etc and is described as: â€œRemarkably pleasant, soothing spaces in which to relax, sleep and work, each guestroom at International House celebrates contemporary New Orleans style. Average size is 300 square feet, and each of the 117 rooms offers a spa-like bathroom, glass shower or oversized bathtub, Aveda bath amenities, abundant natural light, I-home, ceiling fan, two-line speakerphone, complimentary wireless service, original black and white photographs of today's local jazz greats and fresh Louisiana wildflowersâ€�. When we arrived at the hotel, they initially put us in a room on the top floor with two small double beds and where there were two windows of approximately 2ft x 2ft that finished at chest height above the floor, with no curtains or net curtains, ceiling fan etc. We phoned reception and asked if they could put us in a queen double as requested which they said they would do. We were moved next door into a room with a queen double, but unfortunately: 1) It was so small that there was no room for a desk or chair as advertised. 2) The windows in this room were again, 2ft x 2ft square and chest height above the floor, with no curtains or net curtains, just painted brown venetian blinds. 3) The room was directly opposite another so without the net curtains, the other room could look straight in on us. To protect our privacy, we had to shut the blinds which meant the room was either dingy and overlooked with blinds open, or very dark and private with them down. 4) As a result of the two tiny windows, the room was extremely dark so no â€œabundant natural lightâ€�. 5) The bathroom had not been refurbished (the manager told us they hadnâ€™t got to that room yet) so there were no â€œAveda productsâ€�, just generic supermarket branded soap, and the sink was an old stainless steel affair. 6) There was no ceiling fan and the ceiling itself was rough, uncovered concrete. We telephoned reception who apologised but said that there were no other available rooms for that night. They said that instead, they would try to move us the next day so we had to unpack, then repack and then leave our bags the next day which meant taking our valuables with us. Itâ€™s worth noting at this point that when we asked the receptionist why our room was so poor, she said it was because â€œit was a third party bookingâ€�. I.e. Expedia customers get the last choice and thus worst rooms. So be very careful as if you book through a third party website, it seems that you may be "bottom of the pile" on selection of rooms. We have mentioned this to Expedia. The next day we were moved into a room that was exactly as described which I must say was very pleasant and was as described on their website. If you get one of these rooms you'll be very pleased with the accommodation. Unfortunately, the manager on duty simply said that the hotel â€œclass the room as Deluxe, so it isâ€�. We pointed out that they could call it a penthouse, but that doesnâ€™t make it one and that it was fundamentally not as described. After some discussion, we were offered a free night's accommodation which we couldn't take up due to our flights home. Since then, the hotel has offered and refunded a fairly derisory amount of approximately Â£39 to my credit card but we feel that because of the offer of a free night and the terrible room, we should have had the first night refunded. To conclude then, the hotel and location are great, but unfortunately, they ruined the first night of our New Orleans holiday by putting us in a terrible room, so if you book, make sure they don't put you on the top floor where the rooms have these tiny windows and bare concrete ceilings...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, bar, staff.”
Reviews.Author: Elisedab
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The overall vibe was professional yet fun. The staff was extremely helpful. The bar is great! Our room was really nice. Comfortable linens and iPod docks. Loved it all and will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great visit, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: p0rter
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late review but here you go. We stayed at International House thanks to the suggestion of friends. This is a nice small boutique hotel with a little over 100 rooms. We booked on-line and they had a deal that if you paid ahead you got 25% off. We splurged for the superior room and wasnâ€™t disappointed, we stayed in P-1. We had a fairly large room with a view looking towards the French Quarter, so nice to be able to sit in bed and just enjoy the view outside. Bathroom was nice, only one sink and small closet for storage but nice big shower with glass doors. Our room was very quiet and with no nose from the hallway or outside and quiet A/C system. Room had a mini fridge which we appreciated as we are too cheap for the mini bar and appreciated that we were able to keep some drinks cool, the room also had nice flat screen tv and nice radio/ ipod docking station. Found the staff polite and check-in and check-out went very smooth. We only ate breakfast at the hotel and found it a little over priced and a little limited and wished we had just ate across street. I gave the hotel 4 stars but only because 5 stars would have to be perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: dpickens98
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the International House Hotel in New Orleans this past weekend. It was our first time staying at this Hotel. Very nice hotel, friendly staff, spacious rooms, great location to everything downtown. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who will be visiting New Orleans in the future. We will definitely be staying here again. Thanks, Demarcus A. Pickens, MPA, CPHQ

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, eclectic decorations, comfortable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: zakariaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend before Thanksgiving, loved the lobby, had reserved a penthouse room, which turned out to be not right for us. The management kindly changed us to another room and we enjoyed our stay. The restaurant connected to the hotel, Rambla, is lovely and the atmosphere in the bar of the hotel was great. Very central location and the rooms were nicely appointed. If looking for a non cookie cutter experience this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but the quality of staff needs to improve!”
Reviews.Author: BlancaParis
Reviews.Content: The positive things about the hotel: great location (off Canal Street but close enough to the French Quarter), the beds are firm. No-smoking policy is enforced. The wireless Internet worked great, except for the first day (I was told the whole system was down that day). The bad things: windows do not open and thus I had to deal with stuffy/mildewy smell for the duration of my stay. No coffee/tea making equipment. My room was small (imagine a typical hotel in central Paris). The interior of the rooms was worn: huge burn-marks on the upholstery of the chair, the bathroom wallpapers were stained, it looked like the bathtub was about to fall off (there was a huge crack between the wall and the bathtub, all around). I asked for a quiet room but since it was facing the street, I heard lots of noise in the morning (early-morning garbage pick-up?). The house-keeping standard was mediocre--I found someone else's pubic hair in the bathtub my first day; and I found my own hair in the bathtub the second day! What's more, my second day there, I saw someone's room service tray outside their room--and it remained there until 6 in the evening! So I was not too sure about this hotel's hygiene standards after that--I am glad I did not see any cockroaches or rats in the corridor, though I am sure there would be some, if they make this a habit! Now, the terrible thing: the staff. First, I was asked a 200 dollar deposit, because I wanted to pay in cash. This, I was told, was to enforce the non-smoking policy. Fine enough. Later, I found out that since they had my credit card details on record, I need not have paid such a huge sum for the deposit. Second, I had requested before my departure that I wanted the 200 dollar cash deposit back in crisp dollar bills--just like the brand-new bills I gave them when I checked in. I was told by the guy at the reception, no problem. And of course, when I checked out, they did not have crisp dollar bills and could only give me wrinkled ones--which are totally useless in SE Asia (where I live)! Third, I received a package and they lost it. The guy at the reception promised that he will "send a team to look for the package next morning in the basement and on the first floor", but of course, the person at the front desk the next day had not heard anything about this. So I never ended up receiving the package before my departure. Fourth, the person at the reception asked for my contact info so the manager could get back to me on the above issues. Of course, it was just lip service, didn't hear back from the hotel. I really don't like to have one bad staff ruin my experience at a hotel, but honestly, the whole team needs improvement! This, and the combination of the bad things I mentioned above, was too much. If I were to visit NOLA again, I will definitely stay away from this hotel, and recommend others to do the same! The hotel looks "hip" on the outside, but obviously totally flaky.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: onthelevel1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the International House and it could not have been any better. The lobby and bar were perfectly decorated and a great place to lounge or grab a drink before heading out. The Rambla restaurant is superb! I would highly recommend eating there for dinner. We requested a corner room, superior king room and received one on the 10th floor. The veiw was great, the bathroom was modern and roomy, and the chandelier on the dimmer swtich was perfect for hanging out in the evening. I haven't even mentioned the people and they were a big part of making this hotel so great. From checkin, to the bartenders, to the service at Rambla, to the housekeepers, to the doorman.....everyone was extrememly friendly and helpful. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great staff”
Reviews.Author: tripadviser1021
Reviews.Content: Within 2 hours after arriving in New Orleans, as a pedestrian I was hit by a drunk driven of a large pick-up truck in the French Quarter. The hotel staff was absolutely great in so many ways, including allowing for a very late checkout without my incurring any additional fees. There is no question that when I return to New Orleans next year I will be a guest at International House. A FABULOUS, thoughtful staff and hotel deserve customer loyalty!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Zenith8
