Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in New Orleans for a wedding in which the Internantional House Hotel was the host hotel. We were so pleased with our experience. We arrived before the official check in time and the young lady at the front desk was able to be check us in early and we werer able to relax before heading off to the wedding. The staff was so friendly and helped in everyway possible. If one of the staff members was unable to assist you with something they ALWAYS directed you to someone who could. Everything you needed was just a call away. The hotel was within walking distance to all attractions downtow, including Bourbon Street. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful and quiet. It deviates from the "typical" hotel experience which makes this hotel great! I would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Eh - ok, not great - lobby much prettier than rooms”
Reviews.Author: rubygirl217
Reviews.Content: The lobby and bar are very pretty and the location is great. I ate at Rambla (fabulous) and had drinks at the bar the last time I was in New Orleans and decided to stay here based on that experience. I got a great price, but the room was extremely small and smelled mildewy. I couldn't open the windows. Housekeeping was so-so, didn't give me toiletries until the 3rd night of my stay. I didn't spend much time in my room, so I just dealt witht he smell. Probably wouldn't stay there again. For the same price, there are other really nice hotels to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to the action, but far enough away to get quiet relaxation”
Reviews.Author: WirelessTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the action of Bourbon Street and the restaurants and bars. Rambla, the restaurant attached to the hotel is very good. The work out facility is better than most and equipped to get a good workout. The bed is comfy and the rooms are average size for New Orleans. The bar, LOA is a great place to unwind and enjoy a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, and great room!”
Reviews.Author: oliviapoet
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, and is in a prime location. In addition, it is a well-known green hotel and offers sophistication without a snotty attitude. The rooms are clean and spacious, and are close enough to the French quarter to walk to and enjoy, but not so close that the street noises will keep you up at night! A GREAT hotel in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: rxgarner
Reviews.Content: This was our anniversary trip and we decided to stay in a non-chain hotel. After reviewing other reviews we decided to stay here! My husband was skeptical but it turned out to be a great stay. Upon arrival the attendant gave us a map of the area an suggested places to eat and visit. The bartender was nice too. She gave that New Orleans feel, if you know what I mean! Im not a big drinker and didnt know what to order...she made me a Pimms cup and it was good. Great conversationalist also. The rooms are on the small side but the decor and cleanliness of it makes up for that. We had the Deluxe King room. Next time we may try the Superior Room. Overall, this was a great stay and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: decmbr8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the International House from Sept 20-28 with my two girlfriends. This is an awesome hotel. The staff are very friendly especially Jerry who greeted us every morning and gave us great suggestions on where to go to eat and what to do. The rooms are very comfortable and the bar inside the hotel is wonderful. Have a Loatini or ask the bartender to mix you something new! I would defn stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service hit or miss; Amazing bed/bar/atmosphere; Superb location”
Reviews.Author: That_Jen
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the International House - the first was 5 years ago...just a couple months before the storm. We were excited to come back to the place that left such a positive impression on our first trip to this amazing city. We were a bit disappointed that the service was seriously diminished. In this review - unless stated otherwise - the room/cleanliness/atmosphere/sleep quality was outstanding. Exactly what we expected and paid for. This is just speaking to the service quality: Concierge prior to our arrival (Amy) was excellent - made great recommendations, asked the right questions, completed our arrangements and followed them up with an email. Yay Amy! Bartender Lucy was - in a word - phenomenal. Whoever's in charge of these things, please give this wonderful woman a raise! Above and beyond doesn't begin to cover it. Check in was smooth, slight confusion about whether or not our room was ready, but not a big deal, and we chilled out in the wonderful bar while we waited for only about 15 minutes. The telephone in the room did not work. The only time this was an issue was for room service or valet service (we just used our cell phones). The front desk did offer to send someone to fix it, but we declined (it was a romantic weekend for us, so we didn't care). The big problems were with room service. As in many hotels, there is an option of leaving a breakfast order on the outside of your door. One of the options is fruit, coffee, and the 'pastry of the day'. The hitch is that you have to hang it by 11 pm. Even though I've stayed at Super 8 Hotels with later deadlines, this was their policy, so fine. Having been out the night before dancing, we missed that deadline for automatic delivery. My husband simply called down the next morning and asked for fruit, coffee, and pastry. For $32, we rec'd 2 miniature slices of watermelon, 2 strawberries, 2 orange wedges, coffee, and 2 pieces of cold baguette toast. That was the 'pastry of the day'. Seriously? In a Culinary jackpot of French/Creole cuisine? Baguette toast? In addition to that order, he asked for a bottle of Champagne on the breakfast plate. This was a Sunday morning, we were going to brunch early afternoon at Brennan's, and wanted to sip some champagne, as is the way in NOLA. This seemed to really freak room service out. "I'm not sure if I can bring champagne to your room". REALLY? This is a $250/night room in a four star, and you can't bring a bottle of champagne that your bar sells to a room? The next morning was even worse with room service. We'd learned our lesson the day before, and so my husband got dressed at 9 am to walk to Cafe Du Monde to grab beignet. On his way out the door, he stopped at the front desk to ask that a pot of coffee be sent up to the room (remember, no phone in the room). The woman at the front desk looked at him and said "We stop doing that at 8:30." He talked her into bringing me up a pot, and when I answered the door (I had no idea it had been an issue in the first place - not a weird request for coffee at 9 am in a city known for its coffee) she marched in, and proceeded to tell me just how lucky we were that they had coffee left, and that she delivered it past 8:30 am. Huh. Here I was thinking that the hotel was lucky we chose to spend several hundred dollars with them over the weekend. Silly me. My husband is in the service industry - he operates an upscale resort in the Rocky Mountain West. We cater to the same level of client the International House does. If a guest asks for something, even if 'that's not the way things are normally done', all employees know that "no" is never an option. "we'll try our best" "I'm going to see what I can do to make that happen for you", anything except an eyeroll and an explanation of how difficult your job is. Never ever tell a guest how hard you're working to please them. That's your JOB.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking and stay here, it's good and could be great !”
Reviews.Author: Akrut
Reviews.Content: First trip to NOLA , visited with my wife and some friends. Overall we loved NOLA, it was a bit hot (August) but we had a great time. The people, music, restaurants and bars were great as well as the architecture throughout the city. Regarding the hotel let me tell you that I am in the hospitality business and alway do a lot or research when I travel to some place new and after looking at all the best places to stay I picked the International House. I tend to stay away from chain hotels which usually feel generic and cater mainly to business travelers, I look for hip boutique hotels preferably with a cool bar and a good location and I found all of this in the International House hotel. It is located 2 blocks away from The French Quarter and about a 5 - 10 minute walk from the warehouse district so I don't think you could find a better location. The hotel has a great lobby with a very cool bar and very friendly staff. The rooms (we booked a superior corner room 808) are comfortable and very nicely decorated although the bathrooms are very very small. I do have a few issues with this hotel , first of all they need to change the curtains, you have the sun in your face by 7 am and if you are in NOLA having a good time and staying out late you most likely want to wake up late. Second, they don't have safes in the rooms, now this I can't understand for a hotel of this caliber, hotel room safes only cost about $200 dollars. And my last issue is that there are no minibars in the rooms, there was a non working mini fridge beneath the tv but no minibar, what a loss of revenue, I can't believe it. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to NOLA but I would happily pay more if my issues were addressed. We tried many great restaurants like Emerils, NOLA, and August but went to Cochon twice, it's GREAT and it's one place you should not miss !

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: CyliaL
Reviews.Content: I went to NOLA for the Essence Jazz festival in July. This was my first time going to that event as well as to New Orleans. The hotel is in a good location if you do not want to be near the Super Dome or Convention Center. Both are in walking (10-15 minutes) distance of the Super Dome & Convention center so it is still convenient. When we arrived the room we selected was not available. I ordered a double and they gave us a single. I was a little upset because I called the hotel to make sure they had a double and to be honest we booked so late that there were only a few hotels that had doubles available so that was one reason we went with them, the other was because my roommate found out Hill Harper was a part owner. At first the front desk clerk didnâ€™t seem to ready to help make an adjustment because everything was booked so that sent me to the internet looking for another hotel which was hard because Essence was in town. Long story short they moved us to a room with a king size bed. The other bed had to have been an xl- twin it certainly wasnâ€™t even a queen or even a full size bed. Anyway they made the change with no charge for the upgrade this room was a lot bigger and so we made the best of it. The hotel is cute nice NOLA accents, they had several events including a breakfast and evening happy hour that Hill Harper came to. Nice photo ops. We saw Tre Songs (?) & TI there although I didnâ€™t recognize them till the other women started yelling and fanning themselves. Lol All in all it is a nice location but you get what you pay for and it was over $200 a night so no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “For the discerning traveller a really excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: agscamden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located. Close enough to hop into French Quarter in a matter of minutes but far enough away to relax. It's also about a 25 minute walk down Magazine Street to the Garden District and an avenue of great , independent quirky shops and services. We stayed in a deluxe king room and it was perfect for our needs (4 days as part of a 3 week holiday). A great big comfy bed in a casually elegant room, and a great bathroom with AVEDA products. The Bar is really cool. Great atmosphere throughout the evening and excellent bar tenders. Having seen what the competition is in New Orleans if you want a quality, value for money boutique hotel in New Orleans look no further

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!! GREAT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: MBAKE61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a close getaway as we were leaving our 4 month old behind with grandparents. WOW this place was amazing! Great location! We booked our room online and when we checked in we received a free upgrade and we were in probably the nicest room in the place. The service was exceptional as well. India, a customer service rep greeted us as we arrived around 2 (check in is at 4pm) so our room was not ready yet. I am breastfeeding and needed a private room so the staff lead us up to a private meeting room! I will for sure stay at the hotel again and again! I recommend this place to everyone, who knows you may get a free upgrade!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's fine.”
Reviews.Author: tiff21x
Reviews.Content: Decent location, if coming from I-10 E make right onto Canal St. until you see see Camp St. go up one block because Camp is a one way street that you cant make a right turn on to , didnt see it at first because the name doesnt stick out at you when trying to find hotel, parking in New Orleans sucks anyway, so when arriving there was no valet guys out front so I had to double park and have my friend go inside to tell them we needed our car parked, as I was double parked in the street..red hair chick at desk was somewhat rude, didnt say a "hello" but did have a fake "I hate my job smile" on her face but I could have cared less, I was ready to get my drink on in New Orleans, quick easy check in, valet was $33 a night whick in all honesty is a rip off, but like I said find a parking spot in New Orleans near the French Qrt is worse than finding a spot in NYC... our first room had a ceiling fan problem, when we first got there and turned it on the globe fell down and almost hit me in the head.. so we were moved to a better room which was a suite, very nice handy guy helped us move our bags to other room.. nice lobby, rooms are decent and basically do look like the pics,.. there is a $200 hold on the room for smoking which is told up front when u check in, we arent smokers, but as of this review, its still a hold on my card which better be taken off soon since its 2 days now since we left.. there is a trolley car next to hotel, or you can walk to Bourbon which is what we did.. walking distance to Harrahs, Riverwalk mall.. I dont have any complaints overall it was ok.. I only paid $87 a night on expedia..so all in all I was ok with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in New Orleans, ones you try it you always come back”
Reviews.Author: kikevilla
Reviews.Content: Great Service, amazing decoration and details, close to everything and you sleep as home.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel Ive ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Crashed427
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is awful. Very unprofessional. Rambla restaurant is nice and has great food and the lobby is beautiful and those are the only good things about the hotel. They don't speak to you. They're rude. The rooms are sooo small and the beds were uncomfortable and dirty. I dont even wana think about what was on it,but it looked like blood. Also the hallway smelled like someone drunkenly thought it was a bathroom. We told the staff and the smell remained for the rest of our trip. At one point, I waited 15 minutes at the front desk while staff was in the back eating a sub and watching a soccer game,so I just called my own cab. It was a lot of little things,but it made me irritable for my whole trip and of all the times Ive been to New Orleans, this was the worst trip there. I will definitely visit New Orleans again and I may eat at Rambla,but I will NEVER stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price in handy location”
Reviews.Author: Steviem71
Reviews.Content: it's worth paying the extra money for a larger room as reading the reviews I can tell it makes all the difference. Good free wi-fi and front desk good with suggestions for local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: DNW1971
Reviews.Content: The lobby is absoulutely beautiful. The bar is wonderful. The hotel itself seems a little rundown. The first room we were assigned to was without a functioning A/C unit. Can you imagine New Orleans and no A/C? Our second room had a marginally working A/C, but a ceiling fan, so we made do. The maid forgot to put replace the toilet paper in our room and we had to keep calling to request more. We made do with kleenex since we never did receive another roll. The room service was not available before 7am and was a poor, expensive and limited menu. One morning we ordered coffee at 7am and at 9:40 we recieved it after having to go down to the front desk to complain. The TV offered no ppv movies and the cable channels were limited. One night on my way out to meet my husband it was raining and the front door man had gone to dinner. The front desk clerk said there were no umbrellas to assist me to my car. After I confronted him about the fact that the hotel didn't have 1 umbrella so that I would not get drenched getting to my valet'd car (32.00 per day) he suddenly found one and walked me to my car not speaking a work and barely covering me. He made sure he covered himself with the umbrella! I know this sounds petty, but I have never been treated so poorly by anyone in a hotel in my life!!!! The day doorman was the ONLY positive thing going for this hotel. He was kind and eager to assist in any way! I will never stay in this hotel or recommend this hotel to anyone who values customer service!!! Also couldn't connect to the free high speed internet. Had to connect to La Quinta's next door!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ewhiting
Reviews.Content: We love the International House Hotel! From the over-the-top lobby bar (which was packed with a glamorous crowd all night) to the quiet rooms, punctuated with black and white photographs of New Orleans jazz greats, this hotel makes you feel at home in the Big Easy. The staff is friendly and knowledgable about places to eat and things to do in the City. The hotel is located just outside the French Quarter -- a bit quieter but within walking distance to great restaurants and music venues -- and within a block of the streetcar that runs up St. Charles to the Garden District. We've stayed at the International House Hotel a dozen times and we'll be back again in the Fall.

Reviews.Title: “If only rooms were as nice as lobby...”
Reviews.Author: 38ylrik
Reviews.Content: The lobby is gorgeous, and flagged by a very classy but affordable bar on one side and a tapas joint on the other. However, for the price, the rooms are nothing spectacular. They are decorated in neutral tones and well kept, but hardly what I would consider 4-star 'boutique' quality. The big perk? Aveda shampoo/conditioner! Otherwise, fairly generic. Comfy beds, good location, friendly service. For the price, I would expect something a lot more impressive. I was disappointed to walk into my room from the lobby... felt like I'd just gone from the Hilton to the Holliday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Hook”
Reviews.Author: Marlon46
Reviews.Content: Since I grew up in New Orleans & worked in the Quarters when I was a teenager, I've always wanted to stay in a downtown hotel & since it was our 18th wedding anniversary & we really wanted to come home & continue helping others after Katrina destroyed New Orleans, we felt even though our family members were blessed by not losing life & even though my family home was severely damaged & was being gutted & prep for repairs, we wanted to come enjoy New Orleans as Tourist, Now when I booked my stay at this hotel I was given what I felt was a great rate, however they explained that They do not offer Smoking Rooms, So I excepted the Non Smoking Room, Then I was informed about check in Times & I explained that I was Driving in from Houston & they informed me that they offer valet service & over night parking, Once I checked in I was informed that they did not allow smoking in their Rooms & that if House keeping detect the odor from Cigar/cigarette smoke in my room they would charge me for the cost of fumigating that room, so I excepted that room & did not smoke, Now the room was clean & very nice, so we went dropped our kids off at their Grand parents home & returned to the Hotel which we used the valet service & decided to have a few drinks at the Bar & then went for a stroll through the Quarters, However every thing was very pleasant, Upon checkout everything was normal however I was explained that they would adjust my bill on the next day after room service had inspected my Room, So we left & days later they issued the final bill & to my surprise, I was charged $60.00 dollars, so I called & asked why was I charged an additional $60.00 dollars, I was told that I was charged a Valet/overnight parking fee, Now I was very shocked, since they went through great lengths to inform me of the No smoking & enforcement policy, why didn't they inform me of an additional $30.00 dollars per day charge for over night parking! So I was given the name & phone number to the Hotel manager & for 2 weeks I attempted to contact her, Finally after 3 weeks I was contacted by an employee from the Hotel, Now I explained that I was very angry with this because I was never informed that they would use such tactics, however I was more upset because had I known, I would have made other arraignments, Since I have a brother who has a House on the west bank of New Orleans in Gretna, However the real kicker is he has a very large yard & it accommodates 4 vehicles easily beyond his gate & opened 6, then his home is about 15 minutes from the hotel & at most $5.00 dollars each way including tips, then He operates a Limousine, so it would not have been a problem for me to park at his home & ride a cab or have him or his wife drop us off at the Hotel, What made matter worst was when I explained that to the person who I had spoken with she knew the area & the Limousine company my Brother works for & was in agreement with the distance & cost of riding cab to & from since she lives in the same area & know for a fact that those options would have been wise, Had I knew of the $60.00 charge up front, However she said she would speak to the manager & weeks went by & finally when I did speak with the Manager she explained that yes they should have explained upfront, However she could not remove the charge, So I asked her to split the cost, since I stay in Hotels 4 to 6 times a year & would continue to utilize her Hotel, However she even refused that offer, So I continued coming home as a tourist, however I just never stay or spend money with those pirates!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: drdud
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at different hotels in New Orleans, but will make a point to return here. Very nice location, excellent service, very interesting bar and modern lobby. The room was small but very comfortable (most older hotel buildings have small rooms in NO). No desk but we were not there for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: LSUstew
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for two nights for a friend's wedding. Since we live in Baton Rouge, we frequent New Orleans on a fairly regular basis and have stayed at many different hotels. While some of the other reviews are correct (as far as the late night noise goes), overall, we really enjoyed our stay at IHH and will probably stay there again. For the price you pay, the rooms are a little small (we were in the deluxe king), but the bedding was comfortable, the bathroom was large, everything was clean, and there was a cieling fan in the bedroom which is pretty rare. We visited the hotel restaurant,, Rambla first and the service and drinks there were top noch! We also visited the hotel bar, Loa, that night and it was also very nice (service was a little slow, but there were about 30 of us who showed up all at one time). The front desk staff, doorman, and bellman were all very attentive and made several great recommendations. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the quarter and some of the major tourist stops (aquarium, Harrah's, Riverwalk, etc.), but there are lots of options closer as well. We walked about two blocks to Daisy Dukes for breakfast Saturday morning (at the recommendation of the door man) and made it for the early bird special; 2 eggs, choice of meat, choice of bread, and grits for $3.99. If you don't mind waiting in a line, you're also a very close walk to the famous Mother's (totally worth the wait). If you stay here, request a room on one of the higher floors as the street noise is more bearable. Also, the bride stayed in the largest penthouse, and if you can afford it...it's AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel. Different room, but still fun!”
Reviews.Author: Mazzy0774
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so pretty and although the rooms are different as far as shape and size it was still nice. It was almost spooky, but I loved it! The bed was comfy and the bathroom was a good size. The staff was amazing and there was a party going on that night we arrived with free drinks. The bar was great, too. And, it's a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: PCVM
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel are spare and poorly lit. Fixtures are odd - shower door is on the wrong side so you have to step in underneath the shower. Most face an alley way where trash was picked up at about 3:00 AM each of the three nights we were there. Location is ok, near lots of other hotels, staff is reasonably nice. But in a boutique hotel, all you really get are the rooms, and they aren't very nice. Especially at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, below average rooms. Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Critical_Mind
Reviews.Content: Stayed in IH and was thoroughly disappointed with this hotel in all but two aspects. If the owners/management believe that poor, too cool for school service, tarnished furniture, old TV sets and dirty in-room carpets and windows epitomise 'boutique', then I think they should take a long hard look at their European boutique peers and really improve IH's standards significantly. Was given a room whose name had little to do with reality - superior double. I am sorry, but there is nothing superior about a room which has tiny and stained windows, dirty carpets, tarnished furniture and a 1990s TV set. There is also nothing boutique about it either. No tea or coffee making facilities. No duvets, just blankets, uncomfortable mattress... I could go on. The plus side was the bathroom which was nice, but somehow did not fit with the rest of the room. It was like as if the bathroom was 4 star standard, but the actual bedroom around 2 Star. When I went down to reception to complain about the dirt on the carpet (which was everywhere around the bed and the chair), I did not receive an apology. Oh no. Instead, I was told: "OK. We send housekeeping" I am very sorry, but IH's hotel management really need to up their ante and show some proper customer service standards. If they aspire to be hip and 4 Star, then they should never forget, that too cool for school customer service is not hip at all. In fact, the behaviour of the receptionist just made me think how unprofessional the situation was being dealt with. Whether or not a hotel is a two or five star, rooms have to be clean. And mine wasn't. The same scene continued when housekeeping arrived. Instead of apologising for the dirt, I was challenged that the room had allegedly not been ready, but had only been given to me because I wanted it. That was not only untrue - the same housekeeping person was down at reception when I checked in and told me the room was ready - it also did not make sense. How could you EVER give a room to a new guest if the room was not ready???? Once again, rather than apologising, staff just blamed the customer! Enough said. In short, I have been to many boutique hotels. IH however falls short of expectations in nearly every category. I honestly do not understand the hype about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here every time we go to New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: AMcCormick81
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience staying at the International House. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The location is ideal whether you are spending time in the French Quarter or going to museums in the Central Business District. We definitely look forward to our next trip just so we can enjoy this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel for a city that's hard traveled.”
Reviews.Author: brooklynola
Reviews.Content: I am a resident of New Orleans, My husband & I both work downtown/French Quarter, We got a great deal last minute to stay Superbowl night. For a city hotel, in proximity, it was fantastic. We loved the common areas of the hotel. No city hotel rooms are large, unless you are PAYING big for one. It was clean, bathroom was great. They oversold the night, so they offered us the "Rockstar" room for next to nothing. We really just needed to not drive home, & were ready to start our evening. Didn't even think twice. I don't know about the other rooms, but, we were knocked out in ours. It was like sleeping in a cave. It was awesome. Will go back & try a room WITH windows next time. But will definitely consider the Rockstar Room when looking to just crash for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the hotel could improve”
Reviews.Author: DarCrisp
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic! For that reason - I would likely stay again. Service was only given when required. They said hello when you checked in and goodbye when you checked out. The many times we walked in the lobby, no one spoke to use. The lamp in the room was an electrical hazard. There was no vent in the bathroom, which created a lot of moisture; this is probably why the wallpaper was peeling. Some mold in the shower, scuffs on the walls. A lot of moisture on the interior of the room windows. Nice decor overall. Great lobby! We were there for the Superbowl, so we expected it to be noisy - which it was. The windows offer no sound buffering at all, a big thing to note if you plan on sleeping. You could probably just request one of their "Rockstar Rooms" (windowless rooms) to solve that problem. All in all, I would consider staying here again because of location, but it's doubtful that I would refer someone.

Reviews.Title: “a lot of character and good location for boutique addicted - street noise is an issue”
Reviews.Author: patricesantiago
Reviews.Content: very nice boutique hotel, good location at a few minutes from french quarter, and 10m to main museums.We got a very nice,well decorated, large corner room with 6 huge windows, actually the one depicted on the website. Lobby is very nice, in particular at night with candles everywhere. Hotel offers free coktails on wesdnedays. Don't expect 4 star service, for that go to Hilton. Now, for big sleepers, avoid this hotel. Incredible street noise, almost all night !!! there is car and truck traffic, street music.. Windows are not noise proof (old charming windows). Apparently, international house just opened a sister boutique hotel, might be worth booking room there.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty, noisy hotel in downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveler1970
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping (i.e. cleanliness) definitely needs improvement. Rooms facing the street are really noisy and you should be prepared to wake up everyday at 4:00am with the sound of dumpster trucks working their routes on the street. Service is reasonable and the adjacent restaurant (third party managed) is pricey with a somewhat limited menu. Finally, on a personal note to those thirsty for air: windows are sealed and will not open.

Reviews.Title: “Safe clean boutique hotel in downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: destinationwedphotog
Reviews.Content: i am rating this hotel with four stars, not saying it is a 4-star hotel, but simply 4 stars for accuracy on what i expected. it is a simple boutique hotel in a safe business district that provides a quiet place to sleep, away from the vomit-scented area of bourbon street, albeit a short walk if you need to get there. the lobby nice, and clean, and had a lot of character. there is complimentary internet access in the lobby, along with a bar (we didn't go to the bar here). the room we got was on the smaller side but definitely adequate for two friends. the lighting in the room was a bit dark but nothing to fuss over. there were two smart waters available for $3 each, and hershey bars for $2, for those who need smart water and chocolate to get going. the bathroom was nicer than the room, and had aveda products. one complaint about the bathroom was that there was no ventilation/fan so it got a bit steamy whilst showering. the staff was friendly and helpful. i would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a better than average hotel without going over the top. we paid $500 including parking, for three nights, friday through sunday in mid-may.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Impala08
Reviews.Content: Hi my name is Shelia Johnson and my friend Sammie Moss and I stayed at the International House Boutique Hotel during Essence Music Festival and it was really nice the room made you feel like a movie star, the resturant served nice food and they had a party in the lobby later with a group of employee from Hennessay! Got some nice glasses from that. We plan on staying there every year!!! A happy customer Shelia Johnson

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool hotel, gorgeous lobby”
Reviews.Author: felizjourney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the International House for 4 nights while attending a conference in NOLA. I found the hotel based on reviews and was not disappointed despite having to have the sheets and pillow cases changed upon our arrival due to what appeared to be hair! The staff was responsive when directly asked questions, but otherwise pretty much invisible. The shower is the size of an elevator and very luxurious! The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. The lobby is a great place to meet friends in the evening, very nice ambiance. We ate at the Rambla one night, the tapas and bottle of wine were delicious if a bit expensive. Pros: within walking distance to the quarter, shopping, convention center and other hotels, hotel is very quiet. Cons: no WIFI, no coffee maker in room, lighting is dim in the room. I loved the hotel compared to the other places my friends stayed and will definitely stay again. **Self Park in the Whitney garage next to La Quinta to save serious cash, only $10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby, So-So everything else.”
Reviews.Author: SDallas
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business. The Pros- the lobby is beautiful, location is good, lobby bar is fun, shower was good. The Cons- no coffee before 6 AM. The beds are very very firm. The rooms were nothing to write home about. The hallways very quiet, but the room was so noisy. I felt like the hotel's a/c unit was next to my room, and the toilet was cycling on and off, and the street noise was very loud. It's classified as a 4 star, but there are so many great places to stay in New Orleans, I would put it at a 3, 3 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale atmosphere, down home service.”
Reviews.Author: nburv
Reviews.Content: "Boutique" might not be the right way for International House Hotel in New Orleans to bill itself, as the word evokes trendy but aloof accomodations. The IHH, in contrast, is warm and inviting--both in lush atmosphere and welcoming service. Staffed by warm and hospitable employees, the IHH has rooms that are lovely and comfortable, and the cocktail lounge, Loa is a great place for drinks and beautiful-people watching. The meals I had at Rambla were excellent. The only glitch was that coffee wasn't available until 7 AM. Best thing yet about IHH is the location: just minutes to the French Quarter, but far enough away that I was able to sleep without disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: cupjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights over a weekend. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the 'room' we had turned out to be a suite with a living room (with a huge flat screen TV), a large bedroom (with a slightly smaller flat screen) and a bathroom with a shower that was really a "wet room". The TV had a huge range of channels. There was also a DVD player and an MP3 player. Free internet access in the lobby. The staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly - nothing seemed too much trouble. The hotel is very close to the French Quarter, less than 10 minutes walk to Bourbon Street. There is a bar and restaurant in the hotel which looked very good, although we didn't get a chance to try them - there are plenty of alternatives in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: kbrew6
Reviews.Content: The lobby was great and gave me high hopes for the room but I was very disappointed when I saw what it had to offer. The room was dark and dirty. There was no desk or mini bar and the tv was small and had a lot of static. I ordered room service for breakfast and for $40 for breakfast for one person you'd expect it to be good. It was not. To top it all of the bed was uncomfortable and I was afraid to touch the comforter because it was so dirty. I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was relly nice.”
Reviews.Author: redstickgirl
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in New Orleans during my stay. Hotel was reall nice and walking distance to all major attractions. Hotel staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Will definatley stay here again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: heathernola
Reviews.Content: Really enjoed our stay. Great decor. Staff very nice. Love the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaplat78
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at International House several times over the years. It is a perfect New Orleans experience; sultry and subtle; warm and refined. The new renovations are great. Would highly recommend to travellers seeking an authentic New Orleans hotel with a modern vib.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking!! This is the place you want to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SChana4085
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in high-end hotels all over the world and this is now officially my favorite place. It is very ultra-modern and the rooms are absolutely wonderful. Besides the fantastic staff, the amenities are amazing. Can I just say AVEDA products! The hotel provides its guests with Aveda everything. It just can't be beat. From the free internet in the lobby, to the amazing bar and restaurant. This place is amazing. The walk to the French Quarter is an easy one and the hotel staff is full of recommendations of places to eat. But you would be making a big mistake if you don't eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel. The selection of Spanish/French tapas is amazing and they cure their own meat. Finally, if you are not cool, this place will make you cool just by staying there. Oh and did I mention it is the perfect place for a romantic getaway? Don't look anywhere else. SUSAN ELLIOTT

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, including the bartenders in the way cool bar in the lobby. Small room with all the space we needed and fine amenities. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in NOLA - We keep returning.”
Reviews.Author: LawPrime
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th consecutive stay at the International House in New Orleans. Before the IH, we tried other hotels and B&Bs in NOLA and found them all lacking. To begin with, the location is very sweet, since it is technically in the Commercial District, but only a block from the French Quarter. It is within easy walking distance to Harrah's Casino, the Convention Center, Jackson Brewery (now a mall), Decatur Street (House of Blues, Nip's, French Market, traditional tourist restaurants), Royal and Bourbon Streets, and several drug stores. A short cab ride or vigorous walk across the French Quarter will get you across Esplanade Avenue to Frenchmen's Street, which is where you will find d.b.a. club and a string of NOLA residents' favorite hangouts for music and evening fun. Also, IH is about 2 blocks from the end of the St. Charles Ave streetcar line, which will take you to the Garden District (the first exclusively American residences in the city and the place where Anne Rice was inspired to write her Vampire tales) and Tulane University/Audubon Zoo and Park (about 30 minutes away by Streetcar). There are 2 Taxi stands within a block, just in case the doorman (usually, Jerry) can't immediately hail you a cab. The rooms are best described as "very comfortable, but unusual." IH is a "Boutique" hotel, so there are a lot of designer touches like featherbeds and low lights (which take a little getting used to), a Clock/Radio with a dock for your iPod, extremely foreshortened mosaic art in the elevators (which is fun to figure out), and a big-screen Mac computer in the lobby for guest use. The lobby bar is called Loa, and it is one of the best in the city -- You have to experience it to understand why. The tapas-style restaurant, Rambla, was just reopened, and now offers room service to the entire hotel. If you don't need windows and want to save a chunk of change, you can request a "rock-star room," which may help you to sleep in a little later and to stay an extra day. -Charles Law

Reviews.Title: “Is this it? Really?”
Reviews.Author: dpb132
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before booking my stay at the International House. Certain travel guides call it one of the best hotels in the city of New Orleans. After staying here for 2 nights, I confess I do not understand all the hype. While the hotel has several positives, its shortcomings mask its reputation as a top boutique hotels. Pros: very impressive public space in the lobby. Feels like a W Hotel with the coolness factor. The bar is patronized by an attractive crowd. Location is good, 1 block from Canal St, near other Central Business District hotels. Parking garage 1 block away is cheaper than valet. Very nice bathroom with Aveda products. Staff seemed friendly enough. Free wi-fi. Small fridge in the room. CD player with local jazz CDs is a nice touch. Cons: rooms were incredibly small and incredibly dark. Truly the bathroom is the darkest I have ever seen in a hotel. I don't mind a small standard room, but no desk at all? Not even a little one? No flat screen TV. Television was in an armoire whose doors would not stay open unless you propped a bag or pillow up against them. Scuff marks on the walls and wallpaper. Bed was adequate, you'll find much better at top chain hotels. No views from the rooms. No pool. Tiny elevators. Incomplete: restaurant was closed when I stayed there. Didn't try the fitness center or valet parking. Summary: I probably wouldn't go back as an overnight guest, but I would go to the bar for a drink. You're likely to have as good or better an experience, for less $, across the street at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and welcoming oasis near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: OxfordViajero
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to New Orleans and always appreciate the size, location, friendliness and amenities of this outstanding euro-style hotel within two blocks of the Quarter; rooms are ample and tastefully furnished with high-quality linens and comfortable bath facilities; both the lobby bar and adjoining Rambla restaurant are first-rate and carefully managed; easy parking either at the hotel's own garage or a block away at the Whitney Bank parking garage; this hotel provides a lot of options (including upgrades) at reasonable rates. Tommy and Caroline Rosser (Oxford, MS)

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beebeelafayette
Reviews.Content: Their staff was very nice and prompt when checking in. The rooms were big and beautiful. I loved the decor and feeling of the lobby and bar area. They gave us a spacious room for us to have our meeting. I will be back!!! Brittany Berard

Reviews.Title: “Treated like VIP's!!!”
Reviews.Author: leebug40
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, we felt so important. They took care of us every step of the way. The rooms were clean and beautiful!! I will go back and take my family!! Lee Anne Meaux

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Restaurant, Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl0708
Reviews.Content: From the moment my colleagues and I entered the hotel, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay as enjoyable as possible! The decor is elegant yet comfortable and the rooms are plush and beautiful! The location couldn't be better - you are within walking distance from some of the best sights and restaurants in New Orleans yet if you decide to have a cozy night in at the hotel, Rambla, the hotel restaurant, is the place to go! The service was exceptional and the food was absolutely delicious! I will most definitely be staying at the International House again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit was as nice as first”
Reviews.Author: txfamtripper
Reviews.Content: Good location, with easy access to CBD and FQ area. Great service, very comfortable room. Very much of a boutique feel hotel versus one of the massive convention style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A nice discovery”
Reviews.Author: duanefruge
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans to celebrate friends' 20th wedding anniversary. We love New Orleans hotels, and like discovering something new to us. We discovered International House from a magazine ad. The hotel is neat; staff is welcoming; hallways and rooms are nicely appointed; the bed was very comfortable and the view was what I consider to be typical New Orleans. It was a short stay, but our stay was nice. The morning was leisurely - the breakfast staff made our meal very enjoyable. We will be back. Duane and Roni Fruge'

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a boutique, but most reviews were accurate.”
Reviews.Author: 1derlustVirginia
Reviews.Content: Pros: The lobby & bar are true to the photos and very nice.The staff I met were all friendly. I stayed during French Quarter Fest & appreciated the soothing vibe after an active day. Bar very inviting, but I didn't stay long (tired). Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom large enough to sleep 3 on the floor! The fitness center was well equipped (treadmills, ellipticals, weights). Cons: Standard room is very small. Dim lighting mentioned in some reviews is NOT an exaggeration. It is dim even with the dimmer on high.The wallpaper,carpet & armoire in room showed signs of wear & tear you can see in daylight. Window in my room had a HUGe crack from sash to sash (a child could've pushed pane out). Reported it to front desk, no response. There was a gift basket in the room w/ a current date & someone else's name on it. This guest probably got upgraded to a larger room. Informed the front desk. It was never retrieved. Raided it on the last night. No coffee etc, in lobby as was advertised , but, if you can walk a few feet without your caffeine, Commerce restaurant ,across street has coffee, very good breakfast at great prices. As good as Mothers, with no long line. Over all, a nice stay, but nothing that made it stand out as a "boutique" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Chic yet suprisingly sensible and unpretentious”
Reviews.Author: boldyetclassy
Reviews.Content: A whimsical lobby welcomes you with a European sophistication...mood lighting and floral arrangements offer a delightful touch. No detail is overlooked here. The front desk and doormen are first class. Rockstar suites are a pragmatic option for anyone on a budget, or those seeking a romantic getaway. Loa's lounge is a nice place to begin the evening--a mix of hip, professional types. As for on-site dining, Ramblas offers a unique menu with an old-world Spanish charm. I would certainly recommend this hotel to any business traveler or local who wants a hip, boutique experience without all the fuss.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: theresa128
Reviews.Content: I had a wondeful experience at the International House. My friend and I drove to New Orleans for a day trip and as we were there we decided to stay the night. I usually stay in Hilton Brand hotels, but as we were finding a parking space near the French Quarter, we stumbled upon this hotel. We had already looked at a few other hotels that were available for the night, but this hotel had the friendliest staff of them all! Fortunately, they happened to have a rooms available. They gave us keys to look at a few different rooms. We chose the Rockstar room! It was very affordable. The catch was, there wasn't a window in the room. We enjoyed the quietness of the 11th floor and the darkness of the room in the morning. The lobby was very lively and beautiful. The hotel was in walking distance of everything in downtown New Orleans. The shower was huge, and we loved the Aveda shower products! The pillows were very comfortable. We had such a great experience that we decided that we had to stay there again another time. -Theresa Forbes

Reviews.Title: “Grate Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielle711
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel to host out of town guest for my Wedding. Had 12 rooms booked and I stayed there myself. Everyone loved the hoel. Great Location, Great Staff, Clean Rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Charm”
Reviews.Author: BchBnd-LA
Reviews.Content: Though my husband and I are locals, we love to take advantage of being tourists in our own city. We found this beautiful hotel by stumbling upon the hip and sexy candlelit 'Loa' lounge downstairs - which regularly provides our last nightcap before retiring for the evening... great bartenders - great cocktails! We make IH our choice for a weekend of submersing ourselves in all that is New Orleans. This hip boutique hotel is in a great area of town, very close to all the action, but far enough from the constant noise to get a good night's rest. The staff here have consistently been friendly and helpful without pretense - how refreshing! The penthouse rooms are quite awesome but we have stayed in the more intimate queens as well and have been very comfortable. A few highlights to the amenities include a mini fridge for you to stock at your convenience (you'll want a few cold waters to rehydrate after a night on the town!), cd player with a few authentic New Orleans based artist's cd's to enjoy (or purchase), and Aveda bath and shower products. The tapas restaurant 'Rambala' downstairs looks like a happening spot for dinner, breakfast is also served 7 - 10. Things are always tidy and the beds and pillows are quite comfy... good thing as you will want to be well rested for a traditional New Orleans jazz brunch come Sunday morning!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: plaqemeinetravelers
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to New Orleans and have stayed at many hotels in the city. The International House is our absolute favorite place to stay in New Orleans. We love the smoke free environment and the fact that their bar is also smoke free. The Loa Bar is very chic and a great place to enjoy a drink on the comfy sofas and watch the views from the large windows that look out onto Camp Street. The hotels location is another reason we like it so much. It's close enough to the French Quarter to walk anywhere we want to go but far enough from it to be able to enjoy some quiet time as well. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great, swanky hotel”
Reviews.Author: selenac9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in July 2009. Our room was upgraded from a queen to a king. We got a great rate online, os to be upgraded mdae it even better! Room was small, but very nicely decorated. Smallish rooms are to be expected in old builidings such as those in New Orleans. Lobby has a great feel. Very attentive doormen. The room was bright & airy. Beautiful modern fixtures. No tub in our bath, but there was a great shower. Front desk personell were very nice. One bartender had a serious attitude, but the others were friendly enough. Nice bar w/ posh surroundings. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: EricPaul
Reviews.Content: International House was one of the best hotels that i have stayed at in New Orleans. Service, location, and price was awesome. Great place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: caspri17
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great service and great location. Good value for the money. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My New Orleans Experience”
Reviews.Author: mrtphoto
Reviews.Content: When i entered the International house, i was really impressed. I had in mind that it was really small. My first thought was wow!" this is BIG! " The valet cordially welcomed us into this elegant decor. The front desk representative made sure we were well taken care of. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location was PERFECT! Just close enough from the french Quarter but not in the middle of the craziness...! The bar was Great! They had the best Bloody Mary! And of-course the bartenders took good care of us! Overall, i am writing this review because i am totally going BACK!

Reviews.Title: “I wish we had a place like that in NY”
Reviews.Author: UschiNewYOrk
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I had to travel to New Orleans over a city-wide convention. We booked very short-notice and were lucky to probably get the last two rooms at the International House. What a lovely property. Only a few steps away from the French Quarter (which is wonderful as I prefer not having to sleep in the French Quarter) it has a great location as everything is within walking distance. It's a very stylish and chic hotel with large, well-appointed, very clean rooms (not very quiet though as many of them face a rather busy street). The hotel has a lot of soul and did a great job to create a hip atmosphere and adding the special touch of the South to it. The South is known for its hospitality yet I was impressed by the friendleness and the service provided by the staff considering that the hotel was sold out. The Loft 123 is almost across the street and the sister property of the International House. If you have a chance, try to get a room there. The rooms are very cool and huge. It's got a very urban feel and may not be everyone's taste but I wish we had something like that in NY. Now, last but not least - check out the bar: it is a happening place The restaurant La Rambla probably has the best croissants in the US and I would dare to say that they are better than most croissants in France.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a king bed windowless room, which we selected ourselves on their website since it was only $65 a night. Since we are on a budget, all I really wanted was a clean room at a decent price in a good location, and the International House met all those requirements. We loved the atmosphere of the hotel, and the staff was friendly to us, so we didn't really have any complaints. It was only 2 blocks to the french quarter, walking distance to everything to see in NOLA. If you can get past the "windowless" aspect of a room, I totally recommend going that route. They cleaned our room each day, providing new towels and emptying trash. We parked in a $15 lot a block down Camp street. I wouldn't recommend the valet for $32/night unless you want to pay for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: BjornCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel wimsycally decorated, perhaps not to everyone's taste but this is New Orleans after all. Great location just off the French Quarter but in much quieter surroundings. Steps away from the St. Charles line streetcar. Great bar and restaurant!! Had a superior room and got a wonderful large corner one, in a wonderful old commercial building beautifully restaured. The room could have used a bit more color, more closet space, and lotion in the bathroom, but the bed was fantastic!! The gym is not the greatest. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Romantic Quiet, But NOT for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityYall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the International House for three nights on business, due to its convenient location. However, I would not recommmend this hotel for the business traveler. The free Wi-Fi was great, but the rooms, hallways, and bathrooms are so dimly lit, even with every lamp blazing, that it was near impossible to read in the room. The room was decorated in a lovely modern manner- no New Orleans chintz anywhere. And the in-room CD player with local music was a classy touch. The shower (no tub) was large, but again, dimly lit and it made applying make-up for my conference in the morning a bit difficult. The service was lovely from the staff, but I found it impossible to get a cab hailed (the hotel is near the back of the taxi line for a larger hotel). I ended up more than once hiking three blocks to the larger hotel to grab a cab and tipping their doormen instead. I had to do the same thing with my bulky luggage as well, which was the last straw to a somewhat inconvenient business travel experience. I would have enjoyed the hotel, and its proximity to the Quarter, restaurant, an ddim lighting on a romantic getaway. On business, it just wasn't worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on price”
Reviews.Author: coxsone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the International House a couple of weeks ago and found it to be a lovely hotel. It's far enough from the craziness in a quiet part of town but very close to the French Quarter or (shudder) Bourbon Street. The staff were almost all wonderful--only one person threw me a little shade, but everyone else was just great. I had a Queen Deluxe Room on the 10th floor. It had a nice view but it was a little small. Normally, I don't mind that. I spend very little time in the hotel room, really. But I paid 99$ a night (w/AAA discount=90$). If I had to pay much more on a non-Jazz Festival, non-Mardi Gras weekend my review might be a little different. I laughed when I saw the rack rate listed on the back of the door as $479/night. $180/night might've been the top for a non-special event weekend, really. There weren't many room amenities. Free Wi-fi, though, which was great! The bathroom was huge (but no bathtub) with a nice showerhead with great shower pressure. Good towels, nice robe and that's pretty much it. They advertise AVEDA products and they do deliver, but these aren't in the end anything to crow about. All in all, though, I quite enjoyed my stay. I didn't eat any of the food there; it would've been nice to have some coffee available somewhere. I had to go to get some Starbucks at one of the nearby hotels. The bar is very nice but the wine is expensive and the couple of glasses I had were not very good. I don't think too many people order red wine in NOLA, and so it seemed to be sitting for a bit too long. (Still drank it though ;-) However, on Saturday night this small hotel bar turned into quite the scene. Lots of very attractive, young people trying to score. It was a little weird to come back to this quiet hotel lobby and see this crowd there. No quiet late night drink for me. There's an iMac in the lobby for guests to use. There's just one, though, so quite often there was some young kid aimlessly surfing or chatting while their parents were talking in the lobby so it was rarely available. There's no printer attached, but the desk guy helpfully printed out my boarding pass when I checked in for my flight online. All in all, I had a great stay here. My wife and I are going to try to go back and the first place I'll look at will be the International House.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: samiampa
Reviews.Content: We were there for French Quarter Fest. The room was clean. We had a very large bathroom. The bathroom only contained a shower which was fine for us. The lighting was very poor in both the bathroom and the sleeping area. Being over 50 and a woman, this can present some problems. We did not have a car and the hotel's location to the French Quarter was great. The hotel was also reasonably priced when compared to other hotels this close to the French Quarter given that it was French Quarter Fest.

Reviews.Title: “This place is OKAY--I won't be coming back.”
Reviews.Author: sillytraveler29
Reviews.Content: I will not be staying here again. I was here for business and while the location was fine, I felt the hotel was pretentious without offering the amenities a seemingly boutique hotel should offer. The rooms are very small and spare. Decor is meant to be stylish, I suppose, but it has a very dreary color scheme. Lighting is quite dim, which is not helpful if you need to get work done in your room. Breakfast is not served before 7am--also a problem if you are in New Orleans for business, and the menu at the hotel restaurant is limited. Beware of construction - I had to change rooms because of the noise, although this can be a problem almost anywhere. Some staff were friendly and helpful, some were not. Free wi-fi was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “NO wow factor here 2.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: differencemaker
Reviews.Content: Lobby is beautiful and blends well with the bar. Restaurant was closed for breakfast so i did not see it. Room - Deluxe Queen - how boring can it get - all muted the same taupe/greenish tint one B/W Photo framed on the wall - a Sony CD player with no Ipod adapter - 4 CD's for play (i picked the scratched one) and purchase if you are still living in the world of buying $20 cds. I was expecting an in-room coffemaker (it is new orleans) but that wasn't the case although you could buy a pot for $16 delivered (are you kidding me?). The shower (no tub) was large but just cermaic tiled - i was expectig Marble being boutique and all; small vanity with a small sink. The old RCA round tube TV was inside a nice armoire that also served as a mirror. Positive - the room was clean. The Staff was very accomodating and polite - the way it should be. New Orleans has so many beautiful boutique hotels that i will certainly stay somewhere else next time - they do a great job of marketing something they really are not delivering which according to them is Upscale Boutique - oh they also say they were the first boutique hotel in the city which is a misstatement.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 1112!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jakesmom414
Reviews.Content: The ceiling hatch was opened by someone outside on the roof after we tried to tell the hotel that someone was banging on it and was trying to get in. They kept saying "no, no it is bolted shut". Well, they opened it and when I caught them they closed it. We could have been raped, robbed, murdered, etc. my husband just retired after 38 years as a cop and showed them his badge--they didn't care. I had just finished showering and dressing while my husband was at church when the hatch was opened. We booked seven weeks prior to our stay (for 4 nights) and upon check in we were told our room wasn't available because it was given to others the night before. Then we were given a reduced rate and put in room 1112 and told it was a queen with no window instead of a king. Also, the bed was actually harder than the floor--yes, I laid in the floor just to get some rest. The room should not be given to anyone with that hatch in the ceiling! We were so disappointed and will pay more and go to the Intercontinental or the Hilton next time. It is in a great location for Mardi Gras--just close enough to enjoy the parades and Bourbon St and enough to be quiet. We go to New Orleans for Christmas and to Mardi Gras and know the hotels but had never stayed at IHH since it was new. We were intrigued by the web site so don't fall for it. They over rate themselves. Spend your money at a safe hotel where they don't argue with you about a vandal prying open the ceiling hatch. We demanded to be moved and they did move us because people had checked out and they could now give us the king room we reserved. It was a nice room and I would have given an excellent review if our entire stay had been in this room. Upon check out the staff was wonderful in summoning a cab right to the door within minutes as promised the day before. Overall, we have never had such a terrible experience in the past nine years of staying in New Orleans. This first time staying at IHH will be our last because of this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Good - not great”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeHotelJunky
Reviews.Content: I booked the International House largely because I've had good luck with other hotels I've found through tablethotels.com. The hotel was fine, particularly given the rate I got on expedia ($117 per night all in - remember to google "expedia coupon" before you book!), but I definitely wouldn't pay much more than that in this economy. (There are deals everywhere, and you can stay at a 4 or 5 star hotel in New Orleans for under $150.) There are some great things about the hotel that others have mentioned - the lobby, the bar, the location, the free internet in the lobby. Also, I found the front desk staff really friendly and helpful. When we told them our TV wasn't working, they fixed it right away. And when I brought some cleaning down right at 9 AM - the cutoff time that was listed on the laundry bag - the woman said the laundry had already been sent out, but she got them to come back and get my bag. Still, there were a bunch of things that really bothered me. (Besides the busted TV and the apparent lack of communication around when the laundry goes out.) The hotel's website says that all the rooms have an ipod dock, but our room only had a CD player (and some great jazz CDs). I mentioned this to the front desk, and they said that only the superior rooms had ipod docks. (This REALLY bugged me - I hadn't brought my charger specifically because I didn't think I'd need it.) Other things that fell short: there was no coffee in the lobby in the mornings, but there was some set up in the adjoining restaurant - but they charged for it. (If I'd been paying $300 per night, I'd have been outraged. As far as I could tell the restaurant wasn't serving breakfast. The coffee was, I believe, just for guests to purchase.) The sheets were too small for the bed and came off the second you turned in your sleep. There were a few stains on the bedspread and the rug was a little tattered - the whole place just felt a little rough around the edges, sort of unreliable (empty drinks on the hall tables for the entire day, housekeeping not coming until after 3 in the afternoon), and lacking in personal touches and amenities. Again, it wasn't a disaster - but it definitely wasn't great. As a hotel junky, I found it disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margee22
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! It was my second time staying here and will never stay anywhere else in NOLA again. It is far enough away to not hear all the noise from Bourbon Street in the middle of the night and close enough to walk everywhere! We arrived to check in at 3 like everyone else. Our room was not quite ready so we had to wait. We did not get mad or ask for anything but they upgraded our room and gave us 2 free drinks at the bar!! We ended up only having to wait about 20 minutes for our room anyways! We had a room with a balcony that was extremely nice and had a very comfy bed. The bar in the lobby is a great place to hang out. All of our friends ended up meeting in our hotel lobby every night to have a round of drinks before going out. The only downfall is their breakfast- not much to it. There is a restaurant attached but it was just opening and we didn't try it. Maybe it will have a great breakfast when we go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Roadtrip”
Reviews.Author: cpank
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome, and so was the staff. They did the best they could to help you get there even though I called them a bunch of times to get directions becuase the Mardi Gras parades were going and a lot of streets closed off. This is a great spot to be near the French Quarter but not too many good resturants nearby, except for their in house resturant which we haven't been able to try yet. Overall the hotel experience and the staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the International House”
Reviews.Author: tcbinbr
Reviews.Content: After spending a fun evening in the bar at the International House I really wanted to check out the hotel itself. I recently stayed at the International House and it was not a good experience. The hotel staff seemed to be very unmotivated and unfriendly. The room seemed outdated and in need of an update.

Reviews.Title: “International Incident”
Reviews.Author: BRBelle
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the International House a number of times, I thought I knew what I was getting into. WRONG! What was once a hotel bordering on greatness, is now sliding quickly and quietly into ruinous. While checking in for a two night stay with a collegue, the New Orleans Police Department Crisis unit, paid the hotel a visit... we saw no blood, but heard much yelling. Scary stuff. No apologies from the staff - wonder if they are all well acquinted? We had booked two rooms - one was okay, a little scuffed here and there and some odd stains in the bathroom ... the other room's air conditioner was on the blink. Miserable. They offered us another room on a different floor, it was very small and quite dank smelling. Luckily, the air conditioner by some miracle got fixed in the original room. We also had weird unauthorized charges show up after check out. What used to be a charming offbeat hotel with small personal touches, now seems to need a good steam cleaning, higher wattage bulbs and maybe they will regain the clientele they had originally targeted and stave off the SWAT team visits.

Reviews.Title: “Love the International House!!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed during the Voodoo Fest and the hotel was the best part of the visit! Great staff, lovely room, fun bar. Amy, the GM, was super. I look forward to staying again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but their parking rates are outrageous”
Reviews.Author: flash049
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, it is a very nice hotel. However, the last time I stayed here, they charged me $60/night for parking. I was told that they double (or more) the parking fee for SUVs and they would not change their policy. It was quite a disappointment. So, please be careful of their 'low' rates because they will really stick it to you on the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Call ahead”
Reviews.Author: JoJ0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were stunned to be put in a small room with no windows and a creepy door in the ceiling above the bed. We had booked a deluxe king room. Luckily there was a room with two full-size beds available that we were able to move to. We would have preferred a king, of course, since that is what we booked. But had the hotel been fully booked, we would have spent our weekend in what felt like a jail cell with a door above the bed! If you book a room here, you need to call the hotel directly and be sure that you are not the unlucky people stuck in these rooms, which, in my opinion should not be used as guest rooms at all. Apparently there are 5 of them. There is nothing on the International House website or the third party websites that indicate that these rooms exist... plus there is no price difference. On a positive note, the staff was nice, the hotel was well located, and the lobby was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth it”
Reviews.Author: JMBINCA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the International House for 5 nights for Jazz Fest in 2007. It was an awful experience for the following reasons: 1. The room was filthy, dark and depressing. In particular, the decor wasn't at all what you would expect for a boutique hotel. Even though it had been recently remodeled, everything looked really dated and worn. The carpet had tears in it. The furniture was dinged up. The linens looked like they came from a thrift shop. And, to boot, the room was dirty and smelled of smoke (even though it was a non-smoking room). Worst of all, there was almost no natural light in the room, which, when combined with the dreary decor, made it feel like a prison cell. 2. The walls were paper thin. We could hear all the noise from the hallway, as if those making it were standing in our room. During Jazz Fest, people are coming and going at all times of the night. If you're trying to sleep, watch out, as you will hear all the drunken wails from those returning from the bars. 3. The lobby, while very chic, is usually crowded with those patronizing the bar they have there. It is loud and smells of alcohol. I know it is New Orleans, and one should expect some of this...but, I would have liked a little peace in the hotel after a day of craziness outside. Hard to get given that lobby. 4. Front desk staff wasn't particularly helpful. In fact, one of them was downright rude if you ever asked for advice. We tried to get them to tell us the best way to get to the Fairgrounds, and for recommendations on places to eat. You would have thought we were asking for their left arm. I think the issue is that they are under-staffed, and were stressed because they couldn't get people checked in in a timely fashion...much less answer their questions. 5. Not the best location. You aren't in the French Quarter. You aren't far from it, but you do have to walk several blocks. In the hot sun, it wasn't always a pleasant experience to do the walking. There are many hotel options in the French Quarter; in the future, I would choose one of these. And, the neighborhood in which the International House is in still hasn't undergone post-Katrina refurbishment, so is pretty run down (unlike the French Quarter). 6. Rates were exorbitantly high for what you get. All in all, we would definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Parking”
Reviews.Author: alaboe
Reviews.Content: I went to "visit" a guest at the International House this past week and valet parked. When I left the room 30 mins. later, we were told it was $30.00. I spoke to the parking manager, the front desk and the hotel manager and was told the same thing. The hotel manager said they do not park visiting guests and therefore you are treated as if you'd checked into the hotel. This was an outrage and unbelievable. The hotel patron we were visiting was so humiliated, he paid for our parking being that it was a business visit and there were 2 of us in 2 different cars! It doesn't matter if you are staying over night or there for 5 minutes, you will pay the same rate of $30.00. The front desk personnel all the way to the manager were not the least bit accommodating or willing to see the ridiculousness of 30.00 for parking, that is more expensive at the Ritz Carlton, New Orleans premier hotel! Be careful of Parking

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: spindletree
Reviews.Content: This is NEARLY a really nice place to stay -- on the plus side, the room was very clean, nice quality linens, Aveda products in the bath, and a very attractive lobby. Also a fine location, quiet but easy walk to French Quarter or Warehouse district. But it is NOT anywhere near a luxury hotel as per their claim, at least in the standard rooms - our so-called "Queen deluxe room" was tiny, with a soft and lumpy double bed. I called to ask for another room, and was told that "all the beds are the same". The upgrade to King would have cost another $100! (I'm not a large person, just don't like to roll into my husband in the middle of a sagging mattress). "breakfast" involved granola bars, a few apples and oranges, and terrible coffee. Shower only, no bathtub, no pool on premises, efficient but unenthused staff. Kind of disappointing all in all - it's such a fun city that you can easily get exhausted! -- it would be great to have a better room to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: stoopswats
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not for the business traveler. No desk in room, lighting is poor. There was a fire alarm, maybe its all the candels burning in the lobby, and a fire door closed off my room and no one could open it for almost two hours. Gave me three drink tickets for my inconvenience. No restaurant a minus. Coffee and fruit available, coffee is awful. My toilet ran every time it was flushed, call the desk numerous times, no one fixed it. Wasting water on their dime not mine.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Dissappointed Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: D0ct0r_L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at International House pre-Katrina and it was FABULOUS. Stayed for 5 nights for a conference which included the last weekend of Jazz Fest 2008 and was down-right disgusted. Mod hotels (worth $359/night - yes, that's right, was Jazz Fest) should be impeccably clean- it was NOT. Tiles cracked in elevators and foyer, walls need painting, one handle missing on hotel's entry doors (for the whole week?), stains on carpets in the room, no minibar, etc, etc.... The first night I arrived, I got my own luggage out of the trunk of the cab (while the bellman with attitude watched me), then was given a room with no windows and a metal roof escape door in the ceiling. It rained and I got no sleep at all. The second night they moved me to LOFT 523 (sister property) across the street and put me in another dirty room over the bar. Again (although I am coming in at 1-2 AM), got no sleep due to people shouting at each other outside the bar all night! The third night, they moved me back to International House (after Jazz Fester's left) and I finally got some sleep. Friends stayed at Loew's - had great views, superclean rooms, great service, CHEAPER price. Pluses: the manager (although the rest of staff cannot make a decision without him), the bar drinks (although really slow in coming), ran into Tommy Lee at the bar and got a great photo with him. ROCK ON! but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Andbod1
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel - $79 a night, so I gave it a try - why not! I was very impressed by the quality of the hotel, especially for the price I got. It is literally about a minute or two walk and you're in the heart of the French Quarter area - GREAT! As for not having a restaurant, that was not a problem for me. There are SOOOO many great places to eat and try in New Orleans, I would be very surprised that anyone would want to eat a meal in their hotel. You are in New Orleans - get out and experience the cuisine of New Orleans! There are more places to eat than we had time for, so there's plenty of new places to eat when we return. And, you are in the party capital of the U.S., so why would you want to spend your time in a hotel room?
